1.content:
David's POV

It was the middle of summer. Warm weather, not a single cloud in the sky and, of course, no more school. Despite our fondness for video games, me and my friends couldn't in good conscience spend this day inside. Which is why me, my sister Cassandra, and our friends Stephen and Laura decided to go to the park instead.

Stephen and I were sitting under a nearby tree, discussing recent video game announcements. Cassandra and Laura, however, were talking about family matters. Or rather, Cassandra was talking, and Laura patiently listening.

"Can you believe this?" Cassandra exclaimed. "That bitch told me I was wasting my body. What the hell does that even mean?"

She was, of course, talking about our 14 year old sister, Amelia. We don't get along with her.

"No offense, Cassie," said Laura, "but I think she means that you dress like a boy."

"So what? I can dress however I want. She's always been jealous of me. I couldn't care less about my boobs, so why is that girl so upset that mine are bigger than hers?

Leaning over, Stephen whispered in my ear: "Why are girls so obsessed with their looks?"

"I don't know." Shrugging, I said, "It's like Cassie's the only sane one. Then again..."

Chuckling, Stephen said: "I guess the only way to understand would be to become girls ourselves. Fat chance."

Stephen and I laughed as we went back to listening to Cassie vent about Amelia's childish behavior. A few weeks ago, Stephen said Amelia was "pretty cute, but freakishly annoying". That description is pretty accurate. I usually ignore the girl, but Cassandra has a bit of a temper. These two fight a lot.

After a while, we eventually got bored of Cassandra's seemingly infinite rant. I turned to Stephen.

"Want to do something else?"

"Couple rounds of Twisted Metal?"

"Yeah, sure."

As quietly as possible, we snuck away from the girls. I don't know how Laura had the patience of listening to my sister, but Stephen and I didn't. We ran over to my place and fired up my PS3.

Stephen Anderson and I had been best friends since freshman year. There was a team project and... well, we were the only ones who couldn't find teammates. He's a computer nut, and I'm a gamer, so of course we hit it off. As for Laura Clarke, we met her two years ago. She came from London when her dad found a job here. She's always been a very cute girl, the kind who could have been very popular, but that's not how high school works.

Despite her looks, Laura got picked on because she'd skipped a grade. As it turns out, popular girls and class nerds don't mix very well. Feeling ostracized by the popular kids, Laura started to hang out with me and the others; eventually becoming one of our closest friends. She's the feminine presence of the group. That was kinda needed, since the previous feminine presence was actually less feminine than the guys. Laura's been trying to get Cassandra to act, well, like a girl. Good luck with that.

Elizabeth's POV

It seems like this is always happening. Me and my husband, Phillip, sitting on our bed, discussing what to do about our children's constant conflicts. Cassandra and David get along just fine, but whenever Amelia's in the same room as one of these two, that room turns into a battlefield.

"Amelia came to see me earlier today," I said. "She says Cassandra's been mean to her and called her a 'bitch'".

"I'll talk to Cassie," replied Phillip. "But honestly, knowing Amelia, I think she was asking for it. Bugging David and Cassie seems to be her favorite hobby these days."

"Why can't they just get along? I'm getting tired of their constant fighting. Ever since Amelia entered high school, she's been at odds with her siblings. I just hope Melody won't be like that when she gets there."

"They're teenagers. It's in their nature to antagonize everything. Still, I think we need to have another long talk with them."

I agreed. As their mother, it was my responsibility to make sure my daughters behaved properly. If only that were our sole problem. Unfortunately, our family had other issues that needed discussing.

"That's not the only thing we need to talk about, Phillip," I added. "There's still our money issues, too. We're already behind on payments on our mortgage."

"I know, and I'm doing all I can. My job just doesn't pay all that well. Maybe I should get a second job."

"No, don't do that, honey. You'll kill yourself working. I'll find a job."

"But you've never worked a day in your life. You have no work experience, and I can't-"

That's when Phillip's cell phone rang. Probably Larry, his best friend. These two see each other several times a week, to grab a beer or watch a sports match. Phillip answered. After a short conversation, during which he seemed quite shocked, Phillip turned to me.

"We need to talk..." he said. "I think we may have found a solution to our problem."
1.title: A walk in the park

11.content:
David's POV

As we all sat at the table and started digging through our bowls of spaghetti, I knew something was wrong. My four year old sister Melody was enthusiastically eating and making a mess, and Amelia and Cassandra were casually throwing insults at each other, so everything looked normal on that side. However, Mom and Dad were abnormally silent. Too silent. They had an announcement to make, and we probably wouldn't like it. As if on cue, Mom spoke up.

"Kids," she started. "We would like your attention. We have something important to say."

"Earlier today, I was contacted by my friend Larry," Dad continued.

"He's that scientist guy, right?" Cassandra asked.

"Yes, that's him. He offered me a solution for our money problem. His company will completely pay for our mortgage, and throw in an extra fifty thousand dollars... on the condition that two of us become test subjects in an experiment."

"What kind of experiment?" I asked. This was getting interesting.

"Body swapping," Dad said. I was amazed that he managed to say that without laughing. "He has found a way to swap two people's bodies, and he needs to test it on someone."

"So, let's do it!" Cassie said. "Let's just have two of us swap bodies for a week, and then all our problems are solved, right?"

"Unfortunately, it's not that simple," Dad replied. "There's a flaw in the process he's using. He can swap two people, but he can't switch them back, or with anyone else. If we do it, it's permanent."

"We still think we should consider it, however," Mom said. "After all, we do need the money. That's why we're putting it to a vote. I think we should go ahead with it, and so does your father."

"I think... I think we should do it," I said. "I don't really want to be someone else, but you're right: we do need the money."

"I'm with David here," Cassandra added. "Besides, being someone else can't be that bad, I guess."

"There is no way I'm doing this!" Amelia yelled. "I'm not giving away my life for you guys."

"I wanna do body thwapping!" Melody said excitedly. "Da mean I can be a gwowed up, wight?"

I am always impressed by this little girl's perceptiveness. She's clever, you've got to give her that. So that makes five against one, meaning...

"Then I suppose we're doing this," Dad said.

"We've thought about it a lot, and we decided that the best way to choose who swaps is to pick at random," Mom explained. "We'll put all of our names in a bowl, and pick two."

Since no one really wanted to be the one to swap, we all agreed that this was indeed the best way to proceed. Mom went into the kitchen, and came back two minutes later with a large bowl, five pieces of paper and a pen. She set the bowl on the table and handed the pen and paper to Dad, who started writing our names. It wasn't long before there was an interruption:

"Why are you putting my name in there?" Amelia whined. "I said I wasn't doing this."

"Yes you did," Mom said, "but, for the sake of being fair, we think your name should be in there too. And quite frankly, your attitude these days makes us think that maybe being someone else would do you some good."

"If you're so concerned with being fair, then why isn't Dad in it?" Amelia asked, noting that there were only five papers, and none of them said Phillip.

"Because I am this family's only source of income," Dad answered. "But if you think you can handle my job, then I suppose I could put my name in there too."

"Ugh.. I don't believe this."

"Moving on," said Dad. "I think we're all set."

He dropped a the papers into the bowl, and mixed them with his hand. He then handed the bowl to Mom, who picked a paper. After unfolding it, she announced the unlucky winner.

"David."

Wait, me? I was going to swap? I could hardly believe it, and yet it was true. Soon, I would be in someone else's body, for the rest of my life. Please be Cassandra, please be Cassandra, please be Cassandra! Mom put the paper with my name on the table for everyone to see, sealing my fate. She then put her hand back in the bowl, took another piece of paper, and announced the name of the person I'd become.
11.title: Spaghetti and body swapping

111.content:
With an expression of shock on her face, Mom dropped the piece of paper on the table, right next to mine, clearly showing to all our family that she was the one who'd swap bodies with me. That meant I'd be my own mother. I'd become a middle-aged woman. And Mom would become me, a teenage boy.

"So... I suppose that means the two of us will have to become each other," Mom said, still shaken.

"We can still back down if you want," Dad said.

"No. You wouldn't even suggest this if it weren't me," replied Mom. "We have to be fair: my name came out, I'll do it."

"I'll call Larry," Dad said. "He said we can do the procedure a week from now."

"I need to be alone," I said.

I left the room in a hurry, leaving my barely touched meal behind. I was starving, but I didn't even care. They'd just told me I'd have to spend the rest of my life as my mother! I ran into my room and lied down on the bed. I half expected to start crying uncontrollably, but I didn't: truth be told, I was simply unable to process the consequences of what just happened. Instead, I just laid there, staring at nothing, with my brain trying to reboot after a complete crash. I barely noticed the door opening.

"Dude, are you okay?" Cassandra asked.

"What do you want?"

"This is my room too," she replied. "I'm allowed to come in here after dinner."

"Dinner's already over?"

"Yeah, it's been half an hour since you left."

Half an hour? It didn't feel that long. Then again, I wasn't really paying attention to the passage of time. Cassie sat on her own bed, facing me.

"Listen, I know that's a huge shock. I didn't expect that either. But you gotta keep it together."

"Easy for you to say, you're not the one who'll get turned into a housewife next week."

"I know, but... look, you'll get used to it eventually. We all will. And then things will be normal again... mostly. And the rest of our problems will be solved. It probably won't even be that bad."

"I know. If being Mom was so horrible, she wouldn't have put up with it all this time. The problem is that I won't be me."

"You'll always be you... just in a different body. But you'll still have me, Stephen and Laura. It'll be okay."

"I hope you're right about this. I really do. I'm just... scared. When I voted in favor of the swap, I didn't think it would be me. I figured it might be something like you and Amelia, maybe."

"F**k no, that would've been horrible. Look, I know it sounds bad, but you don't have much of a choice, here. You'll just have to get used to being Mom. For what it's worth, I'm sure you'll make a great mother."

"Oh thanks, that makes me feel so much better," I replied, sarcastically.

"Now come on, you can't keep moping like that," Cassie said, as she turned on the TV. She handed me a DualShock. "I'm gonna play Killzone. Now you can either play with me and get your mind off this, or cry in a corner. Your choice."

She was right about one thing: crying wouldn't solve anything. If I was gonna be Mom for the rest of my life, I might as well enjoy my last week as me. I picked up the controller and started playing.
111.title: Doomed

1111.content:
Well, that was it. The week was over. I'd spent it doing the same things I always did: playing video games and reading comic books. You'd think I'd be doing something less... normal, the kind of thing I'd always wanted to do but never could. But I didn't want to spend my last week as myself like that; I wanted to spend it just being me, pretending it wasn't going to end. I spent a fair amount of time with my friends too: after all, I had to tell them about the swap. It took some convincing, as they both initially thought it was a very late April Fools joke, but at least now they knew I'd soon be my mother.

I wonder how that'll affect our friendship. When this is done, I won't be their best friend David; I'll be Mrs. Mason David's mother who they see once in a while when they come over. Would they just cast me aside, ignoring me as they did my mother? Or would we remain close friends, despite my being almost three times their age? Laura and Stephen assured me it would be the second option, but only time will tell.

I looked at my surroundings. I was in a waiting area, in the lobby of the Ambrosia Corporation offices. It was a big place, but also completely sterile, in every sense of the word. It felt worse than a hospital. And to think this was the last place I'd see as David Mason. Sitting beside me was my mother, Elizabeth. I couldn't help but look at her, examining her, as I knew that soon I would be her. She was a very short woman, something I'd have to get used to. While she was fairly thin, she was also very curvy, with wide hips and a shapely butt. She was very well-endowed in the chest area too. I wasn't supposed to be looking at my mother that way, but did it really matter anymore? Her "assets" would be mine in a few hours! Not that I wanted them.

I also took some time to examine her face. Her features were nearly perfect, with full lips and big green eyes. She was, admittedly, beautiful, even though she had a few wrinkles. Her round face was surrounded by shoulder-length black hair. Looking closely, I could even see a few grey hairs. She was both the perfect image of femininity, and of middle age. Hard to think that this would soon be my face.

"David, will you please stop staring at me?" Mom asked. "It's making me nervous."

"Sorry... I'm really nervous too, you know. I just can't believe I'm going to be you."

At that moment, an attractive woman entered the room. She was young, and had long blonde hair tied up in a bun. She had a big, very visible baby bump under her lab coat. I recognized her as Gloria Adams, Larry's lab assistant. I'd seen her a few times before. She walked over to us.

"Elizabeth, David," she said. "Dr. Thomas is ready to see you. Follow me."

Mom and I got up and followed her to an elevator, which brought us up to the fifth floor, we then followed her through a hallway, and into a large laboratory. The room had been cleared to make space for the experiment we were about to take part in. In the middle of the lab were two operating tables. Between them, a table with two syringes and a bunch of surgical equipment, along with two vials containing a blue gel-like substance. And standing nearby was a tall middle aged man with grey hair. Larry.

"Hi, David. Elizabeth," he said. "I haven't seen you two in a while. How are you?"

"I feel like my life is about to end. Literally," I replied.

"And I'm truly sorry about that. To be honest, if I didn't know your family needed that money, I would never have suggested this. I only want to help you, but I'm afraid this is the only way I can help."

"It's okay, Larry," Mom said. "We're not angry at you. We just want to get this over with."

"Oh. Then I suppose we shouldn't waste time. First, I'll explain what we're going to do." He took one of the blue vials and showed it to us. "This is NeuroGen. It's the substance that made all this possible. We found that, when directly applied on an open wound, this substance could regenerate nerves and brain tissue. Needless to say, the applications are obvious."

"That's... actually really cool," I said. "So, with that, you can heal pretty much any injury?"

"Correct, but this isn't what we're doing here. While I am the one who discovered NeuroGen, the research of medical applications for it has been left to other teams. Miss Adams and I have decided to pursue a different use for it. We figured that, if it can heal brain tissue, then maybe it can be used to connect a brain to a body that isn't its own. In other words, body swapping."

"So you're just gonna take our brains out of our heads, put them into the other's body, and put NeuroGen on it."

"Basically, yes. We don't transfer the whole brain, however. That would be unnecessary. Only the parts that contain, your personality, knowledge and memories. However, some of your skills will probably stay with the body. These include motor skills, language, driving... Essentially, things you do without thinking about it."

So, I'd lose skills... and gain my mother's. I didn't know whether I should be angry or relieved to hear that. On one hand, it would make it easier to adjust. On the other... I'd lose some of who I am. Then again, he did say it was only the things we do instinctively, so it shouldn't really affect my personality.

"What I'm wondering," Mom said," is why you can't switch us back? Can't you just do the same procedure again?"

"I'm sorry, I wasn't very clear over the phone," explained Larry. "NeuroGen has one major flaw: the immune system perceives it as a threat. After the first use, your body will build an immunity to it, and on the second use, the NeuroGen will be destroyed before it can have any effect. Any attempt to swap you back would likely leave you completely paralyzed, or dead."

"So, we'll have to stay as each other until you can find a way to bypass the immune system," I concluded.

"It could take years," Larry replied. "And even then, there's no guarantee it would work on you, since your bodies will have already built an immunity. This is a one way trip. No way around that."

"It's okay. I'm ready to do this," I said, even though it wasn't true.

"Alright, then. Let's proceed. There are two gowns on this table over here," Gloria said, pointing at a table in the corner of the room. "We'll leave the room while you put them on. Then we'll start."

Gloria and Larry left the room, closing the door behind them. This left me alone with Mom. We both grabbed the blue gowns, which looked like the one they have at hospitals. When Mom started undressing, I looked away. It was stupid I know: I'd be seeing a lot more of her body in a mirror, soon enough. Still, I didn't want to look at my mother naked if I didn't have to. I started undressing too, and put on the gown. When we were done, we placed our clothing on the table, and walked back to the middle of the room. A minute later, Gloria and Larry came back in.

"It looks like we're ready to begin," Larry said. "Could you two please lie down on the operating tables?"

We both obeyed his command.

"Gloria, administer the anesthetic."

Gloria walked over to the space between the operating tables. She took one of the syringes, and gently grabbed my arm.

"Are you sure you're ready for this, David?" she asked.

I nodded. She stuck the needle in my arm, and I could feel a liquid flowing into my veins. I quickly became drowsy, my vision becoming increasingly blurry. Sounds became quieter, until I could hear nothing. I could barely see. Then everything went black.
1111.title: Falling asleep

11111.content:
Elizabeth's POV

Wait, what? I'm not Elizabeth! I'm David. Oh... right. I guess I am Elizabeth now.

I slowly opened my eyes, finding myself in a small, brightly lit room. The lighting actual hurt my eyes for a moment, but I forced myself to keep them open, acclimating them to the bright lights. When my vision stopped being blurry, I took a good look around. The room was entirely white and sterile, much like the rest of the building. There was a full-length mirror in a corner, a table with some clothes on it, and of course the bed I was currently laying on.

I looked down at myself. I was almost surprised when I saw how different I was. There were two large mounds of flesh on my chest, covered by the gown I was wearing. Now I understood why Mom wore them all the time. When I was done, I looked at my reflection again. I looked exactly like Mom. No one would ever be able to tell the difference.

I looked at the table again. Mom's black leather purse was still on it. I guess it was my purse now. I grabbed it and opened it. It contained a wallet, car keys, a cellphone, a makeup kit and a few tampons. I shuddered at the thought of what that last item foreshadowed. Anyway, none of these items would be of any use to Mom, now that she was a teenage boy. As I thought, all of that purse's content now belonged to me.

I walked out of the room, only to find that it led directly into the laboratory where the procedure was performed. Larry and Gloria were sitting in a corner, talking to each other. As soon as they saw me, they hurried over to my side.

"Hi, Elizabeth," said Larry. "How do you feel?"

"I'm not Elizabeth, I'm David," I replied, almost surprised when I heard Mom's voice instead of mine. "But I feel fine. Nothing out of the ordinary... well, except that I'm a woman, but I suppose that's not what you meant."

"Yeah, they work fine."

"Can you feel this?" he asked, before poking me at several spots. At least he had the decency to avoid my breasts.

"Yes, I can feel this. Now will you please stop poking me?"

"Alright. Is there anything wrong with your hearing, or your eyesight?"

I looked around the room. Mom was nowhere to be seen. There was another door next to the one I'd just come from. Probably where Mom was.

"Yes, but it's also very important that you get used to your new names," Gloria explained. "You are Elizabeth Mason, now. The teenage boy in this room is not your mother, but your son David. We feel it is best that we refer to you by your new names."

Just then, the door opened. A teenage boy, who I never thought I'd see from this point of view, walked in.
11111.title: Waking up

111111.content:
"Hi... Mom," said Mom.

"Hi... David," I replied.

As my new son stood right next to me, I was once again reminded of how short I was: even in high heels, I was a few inches shorter than him. Of course, that was nothing compared to the strangeness of seeing my own body from the outside, acting on its own, only to the look down and see a pair of breasts on my own chest. The whole experience was simply surreal. And I could tell that Mom was feeling the same.

"Before we can continue, I need to ask you a few questions," said Larry.

He proceeded to run Mom through the same quiz I'd just been through. Her answers were mostly the same as mine. Once they were done, Larry and Gloria looked at each other, a grin forming on both of their faces.

"Everything is in order," he excitedly said. "Both of them have successfully been transferred into the other's body."

"Meaning that... the experiment is a success!" Gloria replied.

Gloria jumped at Larry, hugging him. Both of them had a huge smile on their faces. They finally calmed down after a minute or so.

"We did it!" said Larry. "We have officially performed the first human brain transfer."

"Just thinking of the impact this will have on the world... It's amazing!" added Gloria.

"Hold on... what impact?" I asked. "I thought this was just a one time experiment. You know, just to prove you could do it."

"It's much more than that, Elizabeth." Larry explained, "we could make this public. Make it available to everyone. Just picture a world where everybody could be who they want to be."

"Of course, that's still a while away," Gloria said. "It'll take years before we can make this a reality, with all the legal issues that will inevitably arise. But still: we've done it. It's just a matter of time now."

I had to admit, their dream was a noble one. The world is full of people who wish they were someone else, and that now there was a chance that their wish could be granted. What had happened today might change the world for the better. This idea made me feel better: I may be stuck as my mother, but at least it was for a good cause.

"Well, I'm happy I could help," said Mom, echoing my feelings.

"And we're very thankful to you two." Larry paused, then added, "by the way, I'll be hosting a party at my house tomorrow night, to celebrate our accomplishment. I'd understand if you'd rather stay home, but it wouldn't feel right not to invite you. You two, and your family, are more than welcome."

"We'll think about it," I answered.

Mom and I left soon after. As we walked out of the building, I realized something: I'd have to drive. The two of us had come alone, since we assumed the procedure might take a long time. Indeed, we'd been out for several hours, as it was getting dark; it was morning when we came here. But now, it was just the two of us, and Mom didn't have a license anymore: I'd started studying for it, so I knew most of the theory, but I'd never actually driven a car.

When we reached the vehicle, Mom looked at me, and her eyes sent a clear message: you drive. Fumbling through my purse, I found the car keys and got in the car. Of course, the seat was perfectly adjusted to my new height. It felt a bit weird, however, when I put on my seatbelt, only to have it pass between my breasts. Trying to ignore that feeling, I unlocked the passenger door, letting Mom in. Then, I started the car... and I started driving. It was perfectly intuitive, as if I'd been doing it for years.

Wasn't driving one of the things Larry said stayed with the body? It looked that way. And driving felt great. I started thinking of the possibilities: not only did I know how to drive, I also had my own car. I was an adult, too. I could go anywhere I wanted, do whatever I wanted. But right now, what I wanted was to go home.


The drive home wasn't too long. After parking the car, Mom and I got out, and we stood in front of the front door. We were both reluctant to open it. After all, once we set foot in this house, our whole family would come to greet us, seeing us in each other's body. I'd have to meet my husband and children, while Mom would have to meet her sisters and father. In the end, she was braver than me, and pushed the door open.

Of course, everyone was standing there in anticipation. They'd heard the car, and they wanted to see us. Dad was the first to talk.

"Did it work?" he asked. Mom and I nodded.

"I can't believe this," said Cassie. "It's really you in there, David?"

"Yeah. It's me."

Amelia just stood there, staring at us. Then, she got tired of it, and just went back to her room. I guess even a body swap wasn't important to her. If it didn't affect her personally, she couldn't be bothered with it. For a moment, I wished I'd swapped with her. That would show her...

Melody ran to me and hugged me. "Awe you weawy David?" she asked.

When I woke up there was a blissful 30 seconds where I had forgotten what had been decided the night before. But as the shocking memory of dinner returned, a cold sickness began to fill my stomach. It sounded insane, but if this scientist friend of Dad's was right, in just a week my carefree teenage life would be over and I would become my own mother. I squeezed my eyes-shut against the tears and prayed that it had been a dream.

Why couldn't it have been Cassie and Amelia?! They are both teenage girls! That would have been the fairest swap, although Cassie would have disagreed. If losing my manhood wasn't enough, I also lose 26 years of my life! I go from teenage boy to middle aged woman in a single procedure. No college, no backpacking across Europe, no career or finding myself a girl, just go straight to a 42 year old housewife! Wife! The guy who was currently my father would be my husband. How the f**k would I deal with that? I shuddered at the thought.

That was the worst part. Maybe I could deal with the body swap if I didn't have to take the life that came with it! Right now if another woman was to come along and offered to swap instead, even one as old as mom, I would take it in a heartbeat. Even if it meant being someone else's wife, at least I wouldn't be married to my father and maybe I would even have some kind of life. I mean, I love my Mom, but she wasn't exactly a great role model for ambition. She had no college degree, no qualifications of any kind and had never worked. She would probably tell you that being a homemaker was its own reward. I guess I would find out.

I lay in bed listening to Philip in the shower, basking in the afterglow of an orgasm. I planned to make the most of these. After next week it would be a while before I would have sex again and it would definitely not feel like this anymore. I can't believe my name came out! I would become my own teenage son! Poor David, no matter how we sugared the pill for him nothing would change the fact that his world was about to change drastically in ways he mostly would not enjoy. But no matter how terrible I felt, I could not bring myself to wish for a different outcome. Unless perhaps it was for Cassie, staying a girl might have been easier. The main thing was: I would be young again. I love my family and am proud of what I have achieved as a wife and mother, but I can't say I don't regret the choices I made. I should never have listened to my parents, who would not allow me to go to college or apply for a job. They believed that a woman's place was at home.

But now I had a second chance! I could go to college, maybe even go traveling! I had always wanted to see Europe or maybe even Asia, or Australia! Heck, I could go round the world! He would be stuck with the life I secretly found so bland. But at least he would have a good husband. I mean, it would be weird at first but surely he would get used to it? I had never felt so conflicted! I'd never wanted something so bad, yet I felt so terrible for taking it! One thing was certain, I couldn't wait until the week was over so I no longer had the option of worrying about it.

"I had to go to the bathroom. I just figured I would just get an early start on the day" she replied. I new she was a bad at lying, and this was no different. But what would happen in a few days, it was the last thing on my mind. I had planed on telling Stephen and Laura about what was going to happen.

"Don't worry about Stephen and Laura" Cassie said. "I called them last night and gave them the basic info of what will happen"

"Thanks sis" I said.

After breakfast, I went over to Stephens house to play some video games. I planed on trying to do everything I normally do, but with my friends.

Cassandra's POV

After David left to go and hang out with his friends, I joined mom as she called Larry to see if we could replace myself for mom in the body swap. I couldn't really tell if it would be a go for our secret swap or not. All mom was a saying was "ok" or "yes I understand". She was in the phone for no more than 10 minutes before hanging up.

"So who will be swapping with David" I asked

"You will." firmly but kindly, mom said. "He said he could take David before you and put him under first so he never sees that he's swapping bodies with his twin" she said.

"Thanks mom. I think David will be more conferrable being me instead of you" I told her. "Still, I don't want to keep him in the dark, one of us has to tell him."

Mom nodded. "I can tell him, if you want." she offered.
11123.title: A Suprise from Cassie

111231.content:
David's POV

I must admit, I was shocked when Cassandra told me of the change of plans but I was glad that she volunteered. The rest of the week afterwards went by uneventfully. We left for the procedure around 8 o'clock am. It was a short, quiet car ride. Mom and Dad were in the front seats, and I was in the back with Cassie. Amelia had stayed home so Melody wasn't home alone. We had planed on leaving them home, mostly because Amelia would complain the whole time about being bord and we knew we couldn't entertain Melody the whole time. When we arived, Dr. Thomas was waiting for us.

"Thank you very much for doing this" he said. "I would never have asked this of you had I not known you needed the money"

"Don't worry" dad said. "We had a family meeting and almost all of us wanted this. its just nobody wanted to be the ones to be picked"

"Yes. Now if you and David could come with me, your wife and Cassie can go with my assistant Gloria" Dr. Thomas said.

With that we went into an examination room. There was nothing in the room really, just a desk, a few chairs, and a wheelchair. On the desk, I noticed a hospital gown and a needle like what they use to give you a shot.

"Can you change into the gown and then sit in the wheelchair please" Dr. Thomas asked me. I did what I was asked and when I sat down, Dr. Thomas gave me a shot in the arm and before we left the room, I was out cold.

When I woke up, I could feel my body was different. However I couldn't move anything. I saw out of the corner of my eye that Gloria was going over something.

"Oh good, your up. Don't worry if you can't move. The anesthetics probably haven't worn off yet." she said.

I tried to say something but I just couldn't. I closed my eyes and fell asleep. When I woke again I was alone and I could move now. I got up slowly, not quite sure how well I would be able to walk. When I stood up, I instantly felt the weight of my new breasts. I still felt weak and woozy, likely from the anesthetics still working their way out of my system. Just as I found my balance, Gloria came in.

"Good your up. I was just coming in to check on you" she said. "Now here are your new clothes."

She handed me some clothes. I looked at them but found that they weren't my mother's. They looked like the purple T-shirt, black shorts, bra and underwear, short white socks and purple running shoes Cassie had when we came here. I walked over to the mirror in the room and was shocked by what I saw. Standing in the mirror wasn't my mother, but my twin sister Cassandra. I now had her shoulder length brown hair, her Hourglass figure, her C-cup breasts.

"Wha, what happened!?" I asked. "I thought I was going to be my mother!"

"You forgot?" surprised, Gloria asked. she giggled slightly. "You're still a little woozy, I see." she sighed. "Originally, you were going to switch with your mother but it Cassandra volunteered to take your mothers place in the swap." she smiled, seeing me blush. "Remember now?"

I nodded and Gloria ran me through a serious of tests to make sure the operation went smoothly. After she was done, she lead me to see my parents. When we got to the waiting room I saw that Cassie was already waiting for me, in my body. It was weird, seeing my body from the outside. She was now the taller of the two of us, but only by an inch. After explaining that I had momentarily forgot, Cassie giggled.

"I'm sorry but I just couldn't stand thinking about you becoming a 42 year old housewife. So I asked mom if I could take her place in the swap." she told me.

"Thanks Cassie. And no offense mom, but I would rather be in my twins body than the body of the women who pushed me out of herself" I said

"It's okay David, I understand." mom replied

With that, we left for home. I had seen a clock on the way out and it said it was 9 o'clock. There is no way we were only there for a hour. When we walked outside however, I soon found out that it was nine at night as it was getting dark out. When we finally got home Amelia and Melody had already gone to bed. When I got inside, I went strait to my bedroom with Cassie. We donned our new pajamas then went to bed.

The next morning, I woke up and momentarily forgot what had happened yesterday. I opened my eyes and said to myself "Why am I in Cassie's bed?" Hearing Cassie's voice come from my mouth reminded me that I'm now my twin sister for the rest of my life. I went over to Cassie's closet (well I guess it's mine now) to look for something to wear today. I was now beginning to be glad I swapped body's with Cassandra because she is the only female in the house who doesn't wear high heels or skirts. Not to say she doesn't have a pair or two, she just doesn't wear them. In fact, last Christmas Amelia got her two pairs of heels and three short skirts. I guess Cassie never got around to bringing them back, because they were in her closet. However, I don't want to wear them any more than Cassie. I just grabbed some black shorts and a gray T-shirt. I put one of "my" sports bras on and some plain white underwear. With that I left our room and went to get some breakfast. I came down and saw that Cassie in my old body had made some scrambled eggs for us.

"I put cheese on yours just how you like them" she (or I guess he now) said.

"Thanks" I replied.

"No problem, I just want to help you any way I can." Cassie said. "Also, Laura called, and she wanted to go for our run with you for a while. She said she wants to help you adjust as well."

"When will she be here?" I asked

"About ten. And just FYI, I find the purple shoes you had on yesterday are the best for running"

"Cool. Tell her I'm in for your run." I said. Ever sense Laura came here from Britain two years ago, she and Cassie would go running almost every day. I guess now, I'll go running with her every day. It was nine right now, so I had one hour before Laura will come over. Just then my phone (Cassie's old phone) said I had a text from Laura. She was asking me what Cassie just told me so I gave her the same answer I gave Cassie. The hour before my run with Laura went by uneventfully. I decided to read one of Cassie's favorite books 'The Hunger Games'. I didn't really have any interest at first, but as I got deeper in the book, I quickly learned why Cassie liked the book so much, we truly had similar interests. I stopped about five minutes before Laura would come over so Cassie could help me get ready. She put my hair into a tight ponytail then pulled out the purple tennis shoes she told me were the best for running. I hadn't noticed last night, but they were kind of springy, no wonder why she almost always had these on.

I was just getting finished when I saw Laura in the driveway. I quickly ran out of the house to be with my friend.

"You know," Laura started "I was wondering if you would be a little more "girly" than Cassie was."

"What do you mean?" I asked.

"Well, I like shopping like most girls, but I never had a friend to go with. I hoped that maybe I could get you to go sometimes?" She asked.

"I.. I don't know what to say, I didn't plan on being girly." shrugging, I told her. "Maybe it will just happen on its own, who knows."

We talked about a bunch of things during the run. We talked about the differences between being a boy and being a girl mostly. She told me that Cassie had some secret crushes at school. Most of the names I knew, but I wouldn't say we were friends. One of them however had asked Cassie out more than once and she repeatedly said no. His name was Brian. He was in marching band, one of the two goalies on the varsity ice hockey team (backup), and also played defense for our school lacrosse team. Because of this combination of activities, most girls weren't head over heels for him. But being an athlete, he was a little more popular than my group of friends. I'm not saying he's a jerk, he just hangs out with some jerks, but he at least will talk with me and my friends.

We ran for maybe an hour. When we walked into my house Laura noticed my new phone had a text.

"You got a text. Who's it from" she asked.

"It's Brian" I told her. "He wants to know if I want to do something tomorrow night" I replied back asking what he had in mind. About a minute later he replied saying "Maybe we could go ice sking then do a movie" I relayed this to Laura who shrugged.

"Tell him you can go." she insisted

"I don't know if I'm ready for a boyfriend yet. I did just become a girl yesterday after all." I informed her.

"So ask him if he has a buddy who would want to go with me so I can be there for you" she said

"Okay." uncertain, I said. I text him 'Yes' but asked if he had a friend so Laura could come too. Thirty seconds later he said that he has someone in mind who would be just right for Laura. I asked him who and he said his friend Curtis. Curtis was just like Brian but flipped. He played defense in hockey and goalie in lacrosse. But he was also in marching band.
111231.title: The Morning of the Procedure

112.content:
As she placed the paper on the table, Mom looked at me with a look of sadness; clearly showing who I'd be switching lives with. I was in denial as I read the name on the paper...Amelia.

Before I could say anything, Amelia jumped in and said, "You've got to be kidding me! There's no way I'm spending the rest of my life as a nerd."

Glancing at her, I said, "I'm not too happy about this either, Amelia."

Looking at the two of us, Mom said, "I'm sorry; but both of you were chosen."

In an attempt to plead for mercy, Amelia turned to Dad and said, "You have to call this off; I can't be a guy!"

"I'm sorry, Amelia; but I can't do that." Sighing, Dad said, "We could use the money, and a change of perspective may be good for you."
Still in shock, I finally said, "I need to be alone for a while."

Before anyone could say anything, I left the table and went upstairs without finishing dinner. Normally I would've loved mom's spaghetti; but I lost my appetite when I learned I'd spend the rest of my life as my bitchy 14 year old sister.

Walking into my room, I collapsed onto the bed. Expecting myself to cry, I simply stared at the ceiling. After a few minutes, I heard the door creak open; followed by Cassandra walking into the room. "Are you okay, bro?"

Looking at her, I said, "What do you want?"

"Hey, this is my room too." Looking at me, Cassandra said, "I'm allowed to come in to check on my brother."

Sitting up in bed, I looked at Cassie and said, "Of all the people in the family; why'd it have to be her?"

"It's the luck of the draw." Sitting next to me, Cassie said, "Sometimes it doesn't work in our favor."

"But I don't want to be Amelia." Sighing, I said, "What would that do to our relationship?"

"I don't know; it may be rocky for a little while." Pausing, Cassie said, "We'll adjust; we always do."


After talking for a while, Cassie and I decided to play a video game. As we played, I realized that she was right about one important thing. If I was going to be Amelia for the rest of my life, I might as well enjoy what time I had left as me.
112.title: Why Her!?

1121.content:
David's POV

With the exception of Amelia, we all sat in silence as Dad pulled into the parking lot of the research lab. Amelia had spent the last few days acting even bitchier than normal; something which I didn't think was possible. In a way I couldn't blame her; as both of our lives were being turned upside down.

I'd spent the last few days alternating between spending time with my friends and having, to my annoyance, lessons from Amelia on what I was to do now that I'd have her life. I couldn't believe that she expected me to continue to be a part of the cheer squad.

After we were signed in, Amelia and I were sent to separate rooms for tests. Dad went with me while Mom went with Amelia.

Once we were in the room, Dad said to me, "How are you handling all this, David?"

"How do you think, Dad?" sighing, I said, "I'm about to spend the rest of my life as my bitchy sister."

"You don't have to be like her, you know." Pausing, Dad said, "Think of this as an opportunity to make her into a better person."

I realized Dad had a good point, just as the door opened to reveal a woman in a lab coat. As she walked into the room, I saw that she was clearly pregnant. "You must be David; I've heard a lot about you from Dr. Thomas." Looking at me, she said, "I'm Gloria Adams, Dr. Thomas' assistant."

"Hi Gloria, I'm David."

Dad stood to the side as Gloria took my vitals and prepped me for the procedure. Once that was all finished, I was placed on a gurney and wheeled out of the room. Looking at me as she walked alongside, Gloria said, "I'm going to put you under anesthetic now, if that's alright."
"It's fine."

"Okay then." Smiling, Gloria said, "I'll need you to count backwards from 10."

As Gloria placed the mask over my face, I said, "10...9...8..."
1121.title: A Few Days Later

11211.content:
I awoke slowly, lying on my back as I had been before, but feeling... different, to say the least. As I struggled to open my eyes, I noticed my eyelashes seemed thicker. Was this really it? Was I Amelia now, never to be myself again?

"Oh, good, you're awake," came Gloria's voice. "I don't know if you can really tell yet, but... the procedure was a success!"

I tried to sit up, but only succeeded in raising my head for a second before falling back down onto the veritable blanket of hair beneath me. I felt a slight tugging in my scalp, confirming the hair was mine.

"Easy, now," Gloria said. "Your body... your new body... isn't quite awake yet."

I let my eyes fall shut and responded with an unmistakably female groaning sound. God, they had done it. This was really happening. I laid there for a few more minutes, and as the feeling of lethargy slowly faded, I gradually became aware of every aspect of Amelia's body. As unfamiliar as it was, it didn't feel as bizarre as I thought it should.

Eventually I managed to keep my eyes open and groggily stand up. I looked down at Amelia's hands, with their slender fingers and long nails, trying to comprehend that these were now my hands, for the rest of my life.

"Fascinating, isn't it?" Gloria asked. "Well, I can only imagine, myself. Although I wouldn't mind trying it myself someday..."

"I can't believe it..." I muttered. I recognised my voice as Amelia's, though it sounded a bit different from the inside, and the soft tone was not one she'd normally use. I continued to gingerly stare down until she spoke again.

"Now, we just need to run through a few quick tests to make sure the swap went smoothly. First, I just want you to walk to the other side of the room."

I looked down at my feet, slowly placed one in front of the other and wobbled a little.

"You're thinking too hard," Gloria told me. "Just relax and start walking like everything's normal."

I took a breath, fixed my eyes on the wall across from me and started moving toward it. Sure enough, I made it there with no trouble.

"Good," Gloria said. "Now turn and come back."

I did so, and on the way back caught sight of myself in the full-length mirror. While the sight of Amelia's body matching my movement was certainly strange, what really got my attention was the distinctly feminine manner in which my reflection strode past, hips swaying with each step. Was I really doing that?

"W-wait..." I said, stopping and turning back toward the mirror. I walked toward the mirror and observed my movements. Yep, that was Amelia's girly way of walking. I backpedaled and watched myself walk to the mirror one more time.

"Aggh! Why am I walking like this?" I asked, vaguely hysterical.

"Ah, yes. Your new body still has the parts of Amelia's brain that regulate motor skills and other such basic things. You'll probably find yourself engaging in other subconscious habits of hers as well."

I didn't like the sound of that. It was bad enough being in Amelia's body, but now I felt as if I didn't even have proper control of it. I tried to reassure myself it didn't matter that much, and I was still making my own decisions.

"Ugh, that sucks," I said. "Couldn't you have avoided that?"

"If we hadn't done it this way, you'd hardly be able to walk at all. If you hate it that much, you'll just have to try and break the habit."

"Oh, I'll be breaking a lot of Amelia's habits, believe me."

Gloria looked a bit concerned. "I understand that, but... try not to be conspicuous. And remember, you are female now and you need to accept that. You can't just go back to acting like this never happened."

"Yeah, yeah, I know... you should probably be more worried about Amelia than me..."

"That brings up another point. Amelia is your name now, and David is your brother. You had better start calling each other as such right away."

I just sighed at that. Well, I was still David on the inside, whatever people called me.

"Anyway," Gloria said, "I need to test a couple other things. Sit down for me, please."

I obliged by sitting on the edge of the bed, which was tall enough that my feet didn't reach the ground. Not something I was used to.

Gloria fetched a little mallet and lightly hit my knee with it, prompting me to involuntarily jerk my leg upward.

"Okay, reflexes are good," she said. "And now, well..."

Gloria hesitated for a few moments before taking the mallet and... smacking me right in the breast.

"Gah!" I yelped, suddenly feeling very flustered at the impact to my sensitive new body part. "D-don't do that!"

"Heh. That's a new sensation for you, is it?"

"Yes!" I indignantly replied.

"Sorry. I just had to make sure you were getting the right feedback. If you hadn't felt that, it would suggest a fairly serious problem."

Gloria put the mallet down on the table, picked up a clipboard and walked a few steps away while writing something down. Then she stopped and looked thoughtful.

"So, uh..." I said to break the silence.

"Hmm. Well, there's some more data we need to gather, but... It would be best to leave those things for later, once you've lived like this for a while. Now then, I'll leave you to get dressed."

I turned my head to look at the pile of Amelia's clothing. "Ummm..."

"Never hooked a bra before? Don't worry, it'll come to you. I think."

"You think? That's not the kind of thing I want to hear from you right now..."

"Well, you are the first human test subjects. The whole point of this is to learn, remember. I'm afraid we can't predict every little thing. Anyway, I'm sure you can manage regardless. Your family will meet you outside the room." Gloria walked to the door, then turned back and smiled at me. "Oh, and one more thing... thank you. You're making a great contribution to science."

With that, she left. I stood up, took off my hospital gown and looked at my exposed new form. I was a naked teenage girl. Somehow that made me feel weak and vulnerable. Shaking that thought away, I approached the pile of clothes. It didn't look like much, partly because Amelia's body was smaller than mine, but also because she didn't exactly dress conservatively.

First I slid the panties on. I had to admit the feeling of the soft fabric against my smooth skin was kind of nice. I knew the emptiness between my legs should be disturbing, but my altered subconscious seemed to be insisting it was perfectly normal.

I took the bra, put my arms through the straps and, sure enough, reached around my back and fastened the clasp with no trouble. Now that it was on, I instinctively felt I could move around more freely. Apparently I had been subconsciously restraining my movement to avoid too much jiggling. It was unnerving to think that I just knew these things now, without even realising it.

I picked up Amelia's short skirt and sighed. I had considered complaining about her choice of outfit in the morning, but I knew she wouldn't care what I thought. As far as she was concerned, her life would still be hers even when I was at the helm. I intended to prove her wrong soon enough. I stepped into the skirt and pulled it up to my waist. Simple enough, but it didn't feel like much of a substitute for trousers.

Next I donned the tank top, which was short enough to leave my belly button exposed. Why did girls wear clothes that didn't fit right?

Finally, I put on Amelia's socks and shoes. At least she wasn't quite crazy enough to wear heels all the time... although I'd half expected her to do so today just to spite me. I didn't feel fully dressed at this point, but by Amelia's standards I was. I took one last look at the girl in the mirror, sighed deeply, and headed for the door.

I opened the door to the incredibly jarring sight of my own body, now inhabited by Amelia, standing there with an expression of equal parts frustration and despair. She turned to look at me, but the expression didn't change.

I had to say something. "Um... hi?"

She just grunted and turned away. Several more uncomfortable seconds passed.

"ARGH! This sucks!" Amelia suddenly shouted in my voice.

I couldn't exactly disagree with that. I stayed silent.

"You!" She pointed a finger at me. "You'd better not mess up my life, got it? Remember everything I told you!"

"Right, because you're going to care so much about my life," I said. Amelia twitched angrily upon hearing her own voice disrespecting her.

"You never had a life in the first place!" she retorted.

"Thanks for proving my point!" Ugh, I sounded way too much like Amelia being bitchy. That gave me an idea, though...

"Alright," I said, "You want me to act like you? Here I go. Ahem. Hey David, why do you have to be such a dork all the time? I feel like a loser just for standing next to you! Get a life or get away from me!"

The effectiveness of my impression, accompanied by the perfect body language, scared me a little. Hopefully it was scaring Amelia as well. She stared at me with every negative emotion she could fit on my old face.

"Yeah, that's what you're like from the outside," I added. "Annoying, isn't it?"

"Are you two fighting already?" asked a bemused Larry as he approached us with our parents in tow.

"Oh, they're always fighting," Mom said. "Why would they stop now?"

"Is that so?" Larry asked. "Well, maybe you'll get along better once you've walked a mile in each other's shoes."

The rest of us silently exchanged looks of "yeah, right".
11211.title: The new Amelia

112111.content:
Nobody in the car said a word, not even Amelia, who had been throwing a fuss since she had been swapped with David. While not a person said a word, thoughts were churning in the mind of David.

There was no turning back for him, he was permanently swapped into his young, spoilt little sister until the day he was laid on his deathbed. But on that deathbed, it wouldn't be him, it would be his brain, trapped in the body of Amelia. David could no longer have a relationship with a girl he liked, get married and be a father, but in the end, he realized he was going to be on the receiving end of the rod, with a man he was attracted to simply because of the hormones that ran in her body, Amelia's body. At this point, David realized he was getting turned on by this prospect, and ceased thinking such a lewd thought, though it was depressing to his male side at the same time.

Both Amelia and David were sitting in opposite ends of the car, and on the other end of the seats, Amelia was churning out her own deal of thoughts, as she twiddled her thumbs.. No, it wasn't hers now wasn't it? These fingers, this body belonged to her damned older brother, even his habits, twiddling his thumbs when troubled, belonged to his body alone. Amelia was going to live in his body until the end of her days, she could no longer try out new fashionable clothing in the comfort of her own body, though at the same time, she secretly craved such height, such superiority to her classmates in school. Amelia enjoyed her thoughts, deeply relishing in it.

The car slowed down, the family had reached home after half an hour of driving. Amelia was first to get out of the car, though struggling not to let anyone notice her momentarily uplifted mood. Amelia smiled with devilish thoughts, as the first to enter the household, amongst the stares of the other family members, who could not believe the sudden change in character, the noisy spoilt Amelia was so quiet at this point of time.

As for David however, left the car in a hurry, with a need to urinate in the toilet at home. He could not blame Amelia for his plight, as this body belonged to him now. He was walking beside his sister, Cassandra, who was giving him words of comfort, though David himself was deaf to the emotions those words contained. Both of them were the second to enter the household, much to the worrying looks of their Father, Mother and youngest child, Melody.

11211121.content:
"Your mother and me have talked about it and we have decided to let you sleep in your old room for one final night. After that you have to sleep on the same room as Melody."

"Yeah." Melody squealed. She was stuck having to sleep in one room with Amelia until then, so from tomorrow night we would sleep together. It would be different from sleeping with Cassandra, after we went to bed we usually would talk about the day deep into the night. Guess I would get my sleep early now.

"Oh brother." Amelia said rolling her eyes.

"Thanks dad." I said with a satisfied smile. He then lowered himself and showed me his cheek. "How about giving daddy a kiss on the cheek?"

11231.content:
My mother finally broke the silence, "Are you really sure you'd be OK being a boy, Melody?"

"Uh-huh!" Melody nodded enthusiastically. "I wanna be gwowed up even if I hafta be a boy!"

I started to protest again but mom shushed me, "Just let your father and me think about this for a moment."

Mom and dad went off to talk in the other room as I sat there, shocked that they were taking this seriously. Amelia looked rather like a football fan watching his favorite team line up to kick a 45-yard field goal to win with only 1 second left on the clock. Optimistic, but definitely tense. Melody, on the other hand, was bouncing around like she'd been told she might get a pony for Christmas. The only real consolation was that Cassandra seemed to be as surprised as I was that our parents were considering this. She and I just stared at each other as I tried to process the possibility of being four-year-old Melody. The idea of being Amelia was bad enough, but to have to live as a four-year-old again?

I was still going over things in my head when mom and dad came back into the room.

"Your mother and I have given this a lot of thought and we've decided to let Melody take Amelia's place."

"WHAT?!" I screamed.

Melody ran up to give dad a huge hug and Amelia, who looked visibly relieved, gave me a smug smile.

"Dad, you can't do that!" I protested again, but mom broke in again.

"David, think about this for a moment, OK? I know that neither you nor Amelia wanted to switch, and this way only one person who doesn't want to switch has to. That's better, right? Instead of two unhappy people we only have one. It will be a lot less stress for your father and me if only one of you is upset with things."

"OK, but why me? Why not let Melody switch with Amelia? I mean, that way they'll both still be girls." Amelia looked less smug after I suggested that; for some reason she didn't seem to like that idea.

"Your father and I thought of that, David, but Amelia doesn't want to switch at all and you at least admit that it's something we should do. Besides, your name was picked first, and if we'd let Melody volunteer we'd have never even picked Amelia's name from the bowl last night. I know this is rough for you, but overall it seemed the fairest way to handle things and to make sure that it's as smooth as possible overall."

I sighed. My parents were right; overall it just made more sense to let Melody take Amelia's place instead of mine.

"I suppose you're right and this really is the best way. But I'm not happy about it."

"It's OK David! I happy for bof of us!" Melody's exclamation drew a big "I win" smile from Amelia as I simply tried to resign myself to this new development.
11231.title: Agreed with Melody

112311.content:
The remainder of the week was actually pretty nice, aside from Amelia "accidentally" calling me "Melody" any time our parents weren't around and the fact that Melody's near-constant low-level excitement was a perpetual reminder of what awaited me over the coming weekend. Still, I'd managed to convince myself that things weren't all that bad. After mom and dad's decision, Cassandra and I had spent the rest of the evening together talking it out.

"I really don't want to be a four-year-old," I complained as soon as we were both back in our room.

"Hey, at least you'll still be more mature than Amelia." Cassandra laughed and I managed a bit of a chuckle too. "Besides, when you think about it, this works out better for you too."

"How on earth does trading lives with my baby sister work out better for me?"

Cassie gave me a knowing look, "You realise that Amelia's signed up for cheer-leading camp in a few weeks, right? And that she's been caught at least a half-dozen times with some boy's tongue halfway down her throat?"

I paused for a second there as I finally began to see what the full consequences of swapping with Amelia would have been.

"And then there's the fact that switching with Amelia would mean you'd be jumping right into the fun of having a period..."

I must have looked absolutely stunned because Cassie started laughing again. "Oh come on. They're not that bad. I'm just saying that with Melody there should be less to adjust to. Plus no-one expects a 4-year-old to be all that consistent, so if you start acting all tomboyish no-one will think it's weird."

I'd been forced to admit that Cassie was making sense, and it really did help me to think of things with all those points in mind.

Telling Stephen and Laura had been difficult; neither one believed me and even with mom and dad backing me up it still took the better part of an hour to convince my friends that this was really going to happen. They were as surprised as I was that mom and dad had agreed to let Melody take Amelia's place, but, as I had, they understood the logic behind it, though Stephen did tell me that it would have been nice for Amelia's body to have a non-annoying brain in it. He agreed that he'd earned the punch that his upper arm received as my response.

Anyway, Saturday quickly rolled around and it was time to head over to Larry's lab and get things over with. While Melody didn't seem to care, I really didn't want to have the whole family around for the procedure and dad agreed since Larry had mentioned that it would take a while, so it was just mom, Melody, and me in the car on the way over. Since I was 16 and had my learner's permit, I was driving. I figured that it was the last time I'd be allowed to drive for a long time so I might as well take advantage of it. When we arrived at the lab, I parked and helped mom get Melody out of her booster seat, trying not to think about the fact that I'd be riding home in it, and then the three of us walked into Ambrosia Corporation's reception.

We were greeted almost immediately by Gloria Adams, Dr. Thomas' lab assistant. We'd met her a few times before, but it had been a while and she hadn't been pregnant then. I was surprised that she hadn't taken maternity leave, but quickly decided that she must have stayed on because of Dr. Thomas' recent discovery.

"Hi David. You're doing a really big thing for both your family and for science you know. You should be proud of yourself."

I made a few noncommittal noises and commented that I didn't really see any alternative, in response to which Gloria switched her attention to Melody.

"And you must be Melody," she said, smiling. "I hear you're really excited about this."

"Weawwy ekthited! Imma be gwowed up!" Melody was positively beaming and I tried not to think about how strange my body would seem with Melody's little kid lisp.

"Well then, I suppose we shouldn't waste any time." Gloria grinned and patted Melody on the head affectionately.

"David, you can go straight into the lab and put on a gown. Dr. Thomas wants to talk with Melody a little bit first just to make sure that she's really OK with the procedure. The size of the developmental gap between you two means he wants to gather some additional information before starting. One of the technicians will take some baseline medical readings for you and then I'll bring Melody in once Dr. Thomas has all the information he needs."

I headed into the lab through the indicated doorway while Gloria took Melody into Dr. Thomas' office. The lab itself didn't look very remarkable. As far as I could tell it didn't look much different than the generic operating rooms shown on TV dramas. I figured that I had better just get on with it, so I disrobed and put on the hospital gown that I'd found waiting for me; I'd only just finished when the lab tech came in and took my blood pressure, heart rate, and a blood sample before efficiently leaving again.

Not having any idea how long Dr. Thomas might take with Melody, I settled in on the operating table and pulled out the copy of "Wired" magazine that I'd brought with me to kill the time. It was a good thing that I'd brought it, because it was at least 45 minutes before Gloria, Dr. Thomas, and Melody came into the lab. Melody had also been changed into a hospital gown and Gloria helped her up onto the other table as Dr. Thomas put Melody's clothes down next to mine.

"Hi David. I apologise for the wait, but, as Gloria explained, there's a big developmental gap between you and Melody and I wanted to be sure I was getting as much information as I could. I suppose that you're wondering exactly what's going to happen. Well, this," he held up a small phial from a tray filled with surgical tools, "is NeuroGen. It allows the body to regenerate nerve tissue in a matter of hours. Since the brain is simply a mass of nerve tissue, NeuroGen allows us to connect one person's brain to another person's body. unfortunately, the body develops a resistance after the first use, so the product can only be used once, but this is still a major leap forward for science."

"So you're physically going to swap our brains?" This actually sounded pretty cool; if I weren't the test subject, that is.

"Not the whole brain, no. We tried that in animals and it caused a lot of problems because most of what we do isn't regulated by conscious thought. Without the instinctive responses that come with the non-conscious brain the animal subjects had severe coordination and communication problems. What we've found is that it's best to transfer only the parts of the brain that contain personality, most knowledge, and memories and leave the rest alone. That way instinctive responses like motor skills and language processing stay with the body and prevent the problems we saw in early testing."

I nodded. That made sense. I didn't want to suddenly be completely un-coordinated in Melody's body, nor her in mine really. And since my personality, knowledge, and memory would still be the same at least I wouldn't lose who I was.

"So," Dr. Thomas continued, "are we ready to start?"

"Yeth!" Melody was still clearly excited about being older. I simply nodded.

"Very good then. You two just lay back on the tables and Gloria will administer the anaesthetic."

I laid myself down and Gloria walked over, placing a mask over my nose and mouth. I could hear the faint hissing of gas starting to flow as she asked me to start counting down slowly from ten.

"10...9..." I took a deep breath and blinked slowly as my eyelids got heavy, "8..." I felt like I was floating and it was hard for me to concentrate on what I was supposed to be doing, "sev...uh...se..." And my world went dark and silent.

I passed off my slurred question as a lingering effect of the anaesthesia as Dr. Thomas started to explain.

"As the human body develops, the brain goes through several stages. Melody's brain, being the brain of a four-year-old, is at a relatively early stage of neruological development, while your brain, being the brain of a 16-year-old, is at a much later stage. Thanks to the two of you swapping, I can gather data that we've never been able to gather before and see if I can find an indication as to whether the advancement through the brain's developmental stages is the result of the academic knowledge that a person acquires or if it's inherent in the brain's neurological structure. If it's the latter then even though we transferred your memories and knowledge into Melody's brain, you're going to end up a lot more like a four-year-old girl than you probably expected."

"I gonna fowget thtuff?!" That was definitely not the anaesthetic... "Wath wong wif my voith?"

"That's just a result of you now having Melody's motor skills and language processing; perfectly normal. And no, you're not going to forget anything. You'll still remember being David and your personality is still intact. Think of your brain as being like a computer. Your memories and knowledge are like data files on the hard drive. Your personality is like a program that retrieves and manipulates those data files. The non-conscious responses are like the operating system; those responses handle things like feeding additional information to your personality in the proper way and allow it to so things like compare stimuli to those memories. And the physical brain itself is like the hardware, the younger the brain, the less sophisticated the microprocessor and less efficient the memory interface. By swapping into Melody's body, even though you've kept your data files and the program that reads them, you've substantially downgraded your operating system and hardware. Does that make sense?"

"I gueth tho..." I was thankful that Dr. Thomas had gone slowly through his explanation; even though I understood everything he said, I knew that if he'd sped through it I wouldn't have been able to grasp it. Right now I felt like I was trying to understand things through a very laggy connection between my mental "hardware" and the sensory input I was receiving.

"Well that's good. Your brother didn't understand the computer terms at all, so it looks like your knowledge and memories successfully transferred."

"Why you cawl Mewody my brudder?" Talking as Melody was definitely going to take some getting used to. Everything was making sense in my head, but it kept coming out in a four-year-old's lisp.

"Because that's the way the world is going to address you two now, Melody, and your mother thought you should start getting used to it right away. Now, let's get started with some basic things. If someone arrived at a house at 9 am and left at 4 pm, how many hours were they at the house?"

"Theven."

"Good, good. Now, you got here at about eight this morning. Can you look at the clock on the wall over there and tell me how many hours you've been here?"

At first I thought he was just checking to make sure that I could see well enough to read the clock, but when I looked up at it I just couldn't make any sense of it. There was a red pointer going around slowly and two black pointers that didn't seem to be moving at all, and then a bunch of gibberish around the edge. None of it meant anything to me, but I didn't want to admit that and for some reason guessing seemed like a good idea.

"Eweven?"

"If you'd been here eleven hours it would be what time right now?"

"Theven pm."

"Well your math is fine, but you're clearly not able to read the clock. It's four thirty pm right now. Elizabeth told me that Melody hasn't learned how to tell time yet, so this is expected."

Dr. Thomas just made a note in the little journal pad he was carrying but I was shocked. I could remember how many hours were in a day and everything about how time was measured, but thanks to Melody's brain I was now unable to read a clock. I was beginning to re-think my plans to be a famous child prodigy as Dr. Thomas continued.

"How many letters are there in the alphabet?"

"Twenty thix."

"Can you name the vowels?"

"A, E, I, O, U, an' thometimeth Y."

"Excellent," he pulled out the copy of Wired that I'd been reading in the lab room earlier, opened it to one of the articles, and handed it to me. "Can you tell me the title of this article?"

Just as with the clock, the page looked full of gibberish now. "No, I can't wead it... I gueth thath cuz Mewody couwdn't wead?"

"Exactly, Melody's 'operating system' isn't passing the right values to your 'personality program' so even though you understand how hours and minutes work and know the alphabet, you're not able to read or tell time anymore. OK, let's move on to some of the other tests."

Dr. Thomas brought over three beakers, two of them were identical short and fat beakers and both of these were about 3/4 full of water. The third was tall and skinny and was empty. He pointed to the two short beakers with water.

"Melody, can you tell me which of these two beakers has more water in it?"

"Dey bof da thame."

"Excellent." He took one of the short beakers and I watched him carefully pour its water into the tall thin beaker, then he put the empty short beaker away.

"OK Melody, same question," he gestured to the short, fat beaker and the tall, skinny beaker, "can you tell me which of these two beakers has more water in it?"

"Da taww one. Ith way highew."

Dr. Thomas made another note in his journal and then put the beakers away, coming back with a tray containing two rows of blocks, one row closely spaced and one row spaced farther apart so it appeared longer.

"How many blocks are in this row?" He pointed to the closely-spaced blocks.

"One, two, free, fouw, five. Five."

"Very good, and in this row?" He pointed to the blocks spaced far apart.

"One, two, free, fouw, five. Five."

"Excellent. Now, which row has more blocks in it?"

"Dat one." I pointed to the longer row of widely-spaced blocks.

He made another note and took the blocks away.

"I'm going to give you some information and then ask questions about it, is that OK?"

"Uh-huh." I nodded.

"John is taller than Mary."

I nodded again.

"Mary is taller than Sue."

Another nod on my part.

"Is John taller than Sue?"

My mind stalled. Why was he asking me about John and Sue? He'd only told me about John and Mary or Mary and Sue.

"I dunno."

Another notation in his journal.

This when on for what seemed like ages (since I couldn't read the clock anymore I couldn't really know how long) with Dr. Thomas asking me more questions and showing me pictures of mountains while asking what a doll would see. I didn't see how any of it was important, but I was happy when Dr. Thomas finally closed his notebook and put the pen away.

"Well Melody, it's very clear that you still have your memories and knowledge, as well as David's personality. But it's also very clear that your brain is processing things the way that a normal four-year-old's brain would process things. You seem to be right on the cusp between Piaget's symbolic function and intuitive thought stages indicating that cognitive development is largely a function of neurology. This is amazing data."

"Tho I thupid..." I moped.

"No, you're a perfectly normal 4-year-old," he reached down and tossled my hair, "only with access to all the facts a 16-year-old boy would know, as well as his memories and personality. It's really most interesting. But it's time to let you go home. I'll let you get dressed and when you're ready just knock on the door and I'll take you out to your mother and brother. I'll be waiting just outside the door."

With that, he lifted me gently off the bed and stood me up on the floor, then walked out of the room, leaving me alone to contemplate what had just happened.

"I can dwess mysewf!"
