112311111112221.content:
I felt immense discomfort as MelodyDavid, in my old body, hoisted me up into the toddler car booster seat. Not to mention buckle me in so tight.
I know that everyone expects me to accept this change, but even with my hybrid mind/brain I still could not accept the reality that I had gone from a high school boy near adulthood to being reduced to a little girl who can't even read. It's even more humiliating that not only has my former younger sister, Melody, been able to adjust easily to my body, but apparently she is going to be able to do everything I could do BETTER according to the doctors who've taken my life from me. Heck the other day Mom kept talking about how much of a better driver Melody apparently was than me....
So yes, I feel quite uncomfortable right now. And most of all, I feel trapped; trapped in my little sister's body, forced to wear her skin and live her life. I couldn't even have my own name anymore. I was David no more as far as anyone was concerned. That name now belonged to Melody. I on the other hand received her name in return. Forced to be Melody. Forced to forfeit my own body and life, in exchange for her's. Forced to have her mannerisms (can't even speak without that annoying wisp). Even forced to think like a 4 year old girl. All this gives me the same feeling of captivity as did the booster seat I was strapped into, having no control over where my life was going from here and could only sit idly as someone else was driving me into the destination they wanted me to go to.

MelodyDavid had already been driving for 10 minutes as I continued to wrestle with the reality of what I now was, just staring out the car window, at a faint reflection of my little sister's body, still not able to grasp that the reflection was indeed mine.
It was then that I noticed that the music that was playing was Melody's old music sing along CDs. Well I say old because technically speaking they belonged to me now. Odd isn't it; normally it's the older sibling who passes their personal belongings onto the younger sibling, not the other way around. Nevertheless what I found the most odd was that I was actually enjoying the music; from Man in the Moon, to Twinkle Little Star, and even Brush Your Teeth, I was actually really enjoying these songs. Previously, back in my teenage boy body, I would be annoyed whenever these songs played, preferring to not play them whenever MelodyDavid would tag along with me on some errand I would run for Mom. That really got me thinking however, back to several months ago when Mom had me take MelodyDavid to the Mall while she "chatted with a friend" (though I now know for sure that she was probably actually discussing with Dad and the doctors over the body swap procedure). I remember MelodyDavid begging me to play those CDs for her while I had responded with a flat out refusal. Not only that but I would also play the music I liked, hard rock, which I knew scared MelodyDavid. Looking back at this as Melody now, I couldn't help but feel ashamed, which led me on an even longer train of thought - or rather memories as I began to reflect on my past relationship with my little sister. Granted I always had a much stronger relationship with my then twin sister Casandra, but I wasn't exactly the best big brother to MelodyDavid. I never really played with her whenever she asked me, yet I always had forced her into a Call of Duty match that she didn't really have the gaming experience for. Perhaps this was the reason why I took my defeat last night and MelodyDavid calling me "a little girl" so personally. Perhaps this is God punishing me or making me see the error of my ways. Perhaps this is what I deserve. Perhaps I am beginning to see things from Melody's point of view.

10 minutes later MelodyDavid parked the car, having finally arrived at the Mall. As he unbuckled me from my seat, he noticed the sad look on my face. Out of concern, as what any good big brother would do, he said, "Anything wrong Melody?".
I looked up to him and said, "Ife ben wondewing...."
"Yes?"
"haf... haf I been a bad big bwother?"
MelodyDavid only chuckled and said, "Silly Melody, you're the little sister, not the big brother"
I pouted and then teared up a bit, which was when MelodyDavid really got concerned. "Sorry I didn't mean to hurt your feelings, I was just teasing" he said
"I know... itz juzt so all coming at me wo fazt." I continued "I also fweel wike I waz mean to you befowe ze swap. Back when I waz ze big wone."
MelodyDavid gently wiped my tears as he said in a soozing voice, "It's ok Melody. I forgive you. I'll always love you no matter what you do. You don't need to feel ashamed. Especially now that you are the little sister." I calmed down a bit as he said this, my tears having dried up. He continued, "All I want to do is be a good big brother for you. Just want you to know that whenever something is bothering you, you can talk to me. It's now my job to make sure you are alright". None of this cam across to me as passive aggressive, but rather comforting.
Maybe Melody will end up being a better big brother than I was, but maybe it won't be so bad having someone to look up to for once as well.

Before getting me out of my booster seat, MelodyDavid asked me whether I wanted to walk (while he held my hand that is) or ride on his shoulders.
While I wanted to be able to have some freedom in my mobility after being cooped up in that booster seat, at the same time I really enjoyed that piggy back ride MelodyDavid gave me yesterday.
112311111112221.title: Reflection

1123111111122212.content:
While the teenage boy half of my mind wanted to be able to have some freedom in my own mobility after having been strapped firmly into that booster seat for 20 minutes, the other little girl half really wanted another piggy back ride. I gave into the latter half as I raised both of my arms up towards MelodyDavid, allowing my now big brother to hoist me onto his shoulders. His hands held my small legs while my arms hugged his forehead.

Once we had finally entered the Mall, I took note of my surroundings. So many people. So many places. So huge!!! While the teenage boy half of my mind wouldn't have found anything special about the Mall, the little girl half couldn't help but find something magical about such a place. I found myself smiling as these novel sensations reminded me of when I had been a little boy Melody'sDavid's age - well my age I guess - strolling around this very Mall with Cassandra while Mom would hold both of our hands. I even remembered how the both of us would beg Mom to give each of us a piggy back ride - Mom would prevent any arguing between the two of us on who have a piggy back ride from Mom by having us take turns (30 minutes per turn as I recalled). Maybe this was why I had given into the little girl half of my mind when MelodyDavid had offered me a piggy back ride. For me it was like being able to relive my childhood memories, granted from a new perspective.

"Alright Melody, where do you want to go to first" MelodyDavid asked me.

Once we got to the pool I bring my arms upward, ready for Melody to lift me out of my booster seat. While the teenage boy half of my mind was still experiencing some discomfort at being strapped so tight, let alone being in a car seat meant for a toddler, the little girl half of my mind seemed to have overcome my any discomfort I would have otherwise felt during the car ride as all I could really think about was how excited I was to go to the pool. I've even been making sure to take my showers at night time just so that I'd have more time in the morning to go through my options in front of the body length mirror in my room. How ironic, I spent 16 years of my life as a typical teenage boy, being into the typical teenage boy hobbies, but 10 years later I've become rather girly in my tastes. Even picking out what shoes to were has been a hassle for me. Part of it might by somewhat out of envy of my best friend Brittany (Melody's best friend from before our body swap whom has stayed as my best friend in spite of knowing that I was not the old Melody), who was always one of the more popular girls in school due to her looks. Guess you could say I was determined to show that I wasn't just 2nd place.

Finally making my decision I put on the red sundress along with some light brown boots. After several more minutes of fixing my hair. While as a toddler my hair was only chin length, I now had shoulder-length hair which I usually let flow.

It's nothing against you Brittany". Knowing that I had almost upset Brittany, I peered from behind Laura and nervously apologized to Brittany, who accepted the apology.
"It's ok Melody. I hope you feel better soon. How come you were hiding behind my big sister instead of of your big brother though?"
Laura, being clever, came up with a rather convincing lie, "well you see, I recently offered to be Melody's babysitter so that David can spend more time studying for school". She then winked at Melody who was looking at Laura nervously. "since I have already watched over Melody several times while hanging out with David, she feels safe around me" While that last part was dubious, I do recall Laura looking after Melody and playing with her whenever she came over, so it makes sense that she would pretend to be my new babysitter. What surprised me however was what she said next, "In fact I'm going to watch over Melody for a bit, so how about you go play with David for a bit".
"But mommy and daddy said that you need to watch over me at the pool" Brittany said.
"It'll be fine Brittany, it's only going to be for a bit, and besides I trust that my friend David is responsible enough to watch over you. After all it's not like he hasn't babysat you and Melody before" Laura said to her little sister as she moved me in front of her. I noticed her winking at me as I looked up at her. "Now David, you don't mind if I watch over your sister for a bit while you watch over mine, right?"
Melody nodded, "Sure, why not."
Laura looked down at me and asked if I would like to play with her, at which I nodded. I was happy that I now had an excuse to hang out with Laura, while Melody was probably pleasantly surprised to be able to spend some time with his old best friend. I smiled at Laura as she took hold of my hand, leading me into the water.

"I wanna go to ze Twoe Stowe" I said. I figured that since everyone was expecting the 'new' Melody at home that the toy store would be a good start for what kind of girl - or rather what kind of Melody - I would like to be.

As the two of us entered the toy store, Melody set me back on the floor, taking hold of my hand as he guided me through the store.
"You could use some more barbie dolls. I always loved playing with the few barbie dolls that I had, dressing them up, playing house, tea parties.." Melody said as she tugged me toward the Barbie isle. I tugged on his hand, which seemed make Melody realize that perhaps he was getting carried away. "Sorry - I guess I should be letting you decided what toys you wanted." He added "It's your life now after all, not mine".

I had the feeling that even with her superior drivings skills and what not, Melody himself was still getting used to being the big brother rather than little sister. I looked around the store, with Melody holding my hand of course, looking at all the different kinds of toys targeted towards different gender and age groups. From the Barbies, the My Little Ponies (though that one has gotten more of a male following ever since the cartoon came out), Transformers, action figures, yo-yos.
After looking at all the kinds of toys that the store had to offer, I felt that I had decided what kind of toy I - as the new Melody - would want as well as what kind of girl I would be.

11232.content:
My mother finally broke the silence, "Are you really sure you'd be OK being a boy, Melody?"

"Uh-huh!" Melody nodded enthusiastically. "I wanna be gwowed up even if I hafta be a boy!"

I started to protest again but mom shushed me, "Just let your father and me think about this for a moment."

Mom and dad went off to talk in the other room as I sat there, shocked that they were taking this seriously. Amelia looked rather like a football fan watching his favorite team line up to kick a 45-yard field goal to win with only 1 second left on the clock. Optimistic, but definitely tense. Melody, on the other hand, was bouncing around like she'd been told she might get a pony for Christmas. The only real consolation was that Cassandra seemed to be as surprised as I was that our parents were considering this. She and I just stared at each other as I tried to process the possibility of being four-year-old Melody. The idea of being Amelia was bad enough, but to have to live as a four-year-old again?

I was still going over things in my head when mom and dad came back into the room.

"Your mother and I have given this a lot of thought and we've decided to be good parents for once in this story and that it is a bad idea to let a 4 year girl swap bodies with a 16 year old"

I gave a sigh of relief
Amelia's mouths words but nothing coherent comes out.

"Awww, I whnna be griwn up!" Melody said before Amelia could muster up words of despair.

"And miss all your good years?" Dad said "You will be a teenage girl soon enough"

Melody gave a pouty face "Wnna beh Grnup new!

"What about your friends?" Said Cassandra "it would be kind of awkward if you were a 16 year old boy."
"I ges yu right" Melody said reluctantly.

"Good, now that we got that settled." Dad continued "We have also decided that forcing David to swap with Amelia is unfair"
"So... We have decided to let David choose between which of his other two sisters he swaps with" Mom finishes

"Me...?" I said hesitantly noticing both the fact that Cassandra had gone pale and the hopeful spark in Amelia's eyes.

"Yes" Both father and mother said in unison, Father continues "We have decided this is best for everyone this way, whatever you choose will be the final decision".

I gulp, any other day I would of chosen Cassandra right off the bat. But the look of sheer look of shock and terror on her face made him hesitate, On the other hand Amelia's eyes pleading with me not to pick her for once in my life actually made me feel sympathetic towards her. After a few seconds that felt like hours you choose...
11232.title: Disagreed

113.content:
"And the person going to swap with David is..." Mom's voice trailed off as the tension became thicker, her hand slowly opening the paper to create suspense.

"Hurry it up already, I've got important things to do." Amelia said impatiently.

"Alright, alright." Mom laid the piece of paper flat on the table. "Its Cassandra."

Yes it was Cassandra, just the person I wanted it to be. "Yes." I blurted out a little too loud. Everyone stared at me curiously, their eyes wide.

"What did you want to be me or something?" Cassandra asked me a bit startled.

Taking a deep sigh I replied with. "Well I'd rather not switch with anyone to be honest. But if I had to choose I'd rather it be you. I mean your lifestyle isn't that different from mine so..." My face turned a bit red out of embarrassment.

"I guess that makes sense, in a way," She replied, a bit confused.

Awkwardness filled the room until finally Amelia decided to break the silence. Amelia got out of her chair walking towards me, a sweet smile on her face. "You know David, you don't have to swap with her right?"

"I don't? Why?" I asked. Was there something she knew that could get me out of this?

"Well, you see David, I'll be taking your place for the swap, you should thank me for being so generous. I'll even promise to hang out with you..." She eyed me up
and down. "Once in a while, when I feel like it."

Of course me knowing Amelia meant never, or maybe if I was lucky once. I honestly didn't want to hang out with her though. She's not someone I really want to be around.

"No way am I swapping with you Amelia. David's name was picked not yours. Besides I'm sure David wants to be me." Cassandra yells Angrily. "Right David?"

"I wouldn't say I want to be you per say, but-" Cassandra interrupts me.

"See he wants to be me, so me and David are swapping and that is final. I wouldn't ever trade my life with you in a million years Amelia."

"Woah slow down there kids." Dad said trying to break the fight up. "The swap won't occur for about a week you know. You can all think about it until then."

"Yeah we know dad." We all said in unison.

"So about me taking your place in the swap David..."

"I'm going upstairs to my room. I don't want to listen to you try to bribe me Amelia." I started headed towards my room and turned on the TV. I figured I'd get in a few hours of videogames to get my mind off of all of this. A few minutes into my gaming the door opened and Cassandra sat next to me.

"So, how do you feel about this David? Are you weirded out?"

I thought about this for a minute. How did I feel? I certainly wasn't happy, but at the same time I really wasn't feeling very worried about it. Even the thought of being a girl wasn't so bad. Though now that I think about it, it was starting to worry me a bit. I quickly paused the game then turned to her. "I can't really say. How do you feel."

She looked at me, a bit of sadness formed in her eyes. "I'm not to sure I want to swap." The sadness quickly faded from her eyes just as fast as it had arrived. "But I guess it won't be to bad."

I looked at her, and paused for a second. I could tell she wasn't very happy about this, but what could I do? Its not like I could do anything about it. "Things won't be so bad, you'll see." I smiled at her, hoping to cheer her up.

"That's what I just said, silly." She laughed a bit, but it quickly died down. "Thanks, David. I needed that." She hugged me and I hugged her back.
113.title: Cassandra

1131.content:
Cassandra and I spent the week, waiting for the procedure by giving each other a breakdown of our daily routines. It only made sense as we were going to be each other for the rest of our lives. "Of course, there will be some minor changes in the order of which we do things." serious, Cassandra said. "Just because you sing in the shower..."

"It helps wake me up." blushing, I protested.

"Well, 'Cassandra' can sing to her heart's content but 'David' will break out of that habit."

We shared a short laugh before mom peeked her head into our room. "David, Cassandra, it's time to go."

"Coming." with a sigh, we said.

The drive to Ambrosia Corporation was done mostly in silence and we soon found ourselves in a waiting area while final preparations were being made for the body swap procedure. Both Cassandra and I passed the time, staring at each other as if to take in who we were about to become. Cassandra and I may have shared a room but we had always disrobed and got dressed either in the bathroom or facing back to back, it was a matter of respect. I was slightly taller than her, but she had similar facial features to my own, we were twins after all. I tried not to imagine what she looked like naked, I would find out for myself soon enough.

"Could you two please stop staring at each other and talk to me." wearily, mom said. "This silence is a bit unnerving."

"Sorry, mom." turning to her, Cassandra said. "We're just nervous, that's all."

"You two are not the only ones." worry on her face, mom said. "Although we were assured that this procedure is safe, it's still experimental... any thing could happen."

I slowly nodded, seeing mom's fears. I had my own but it was too late to back out as a young, attractive woman, Gloria Adams, Larry's lab assistant, walked into the room. She had long blond hair, neatly rolled and pinned up into a bun. A long lab coat covered most of her body but I detected the tell tale bump of pregnancy. She walked over to us with a kind smile on her face. "David, Cassandra, Dr Thomas is ready to see you. This way, please."

Cassandra and I turned to each other and nodded before rising to our feet and followed Gloria out of the waiting area and down a hall to an awaiting elevator. A quick ride to the fifth floor and a few halls later, we were standing inside the laboratory of Dr Larry Thompson. The room looked something out of an old mad scientist movie with two operating tables in the middle of the room with side tables holding syringes, surgical equipment and two vials of a curious blue gel like substance. Standing amongst it all was a tall middle aged man with grey hair, Dr Larry Thompson.

"Welcome to my lab, David, Cassandra." smiling politely, he said. "I hope you are both feeling well."

"A little anxious and nervous." truthfully, I replied.

"Ditto." rubbing one arm, Cassandra said.

"Please believe me, if I did not know your family was in such dire straights, I would not have suggested this." serious, Larry said. "Rest assured that this procedure is safe."

He held up one of the vials for us to see. "This is called NeuroGen; basically, it regenerates nerves and brain tissue almost instantly where it's used." pausing, he added, "I don't have to tell you that the applications are boundless."

"Wow... that's cool." I said. "You're saying it can heal any injury almost instantly?"

"That's right; however, being the one who discovered this substance and developed it, I turned the research of its medical applications to other teams. Gloria and I see a more... revolutionary use for the NuroGen. We know that it can heal brain tissue so we theorized that it can also connect a brain into a body that isn't its own... making body swapping not only possible but a reality."

"So you're just going to surgically swap out our brains, using that NeuroGen to heal everything properly?"

"That's the basic idea but we are only 'swapping out' selected parts of the brain that contain your personality, knowledge and memories. A full transfer will not be necessary as your 'self' is contained within a small portion of the brain. Still, some skills you use automatically such as motor skills, language, driving, and so on will stay with your bodies."

"Why can't they be swapped out?" curious, I asked.

"They are located too deep within the brain to safely swap out." simply, Larry replied. "It works to your favor as boys and girls do certain things without thinking of it as they have done it all their lives."

"I see." wincing, Cassandra said. "Tell me, why can't we be switched back?"

"When used in high doses, as needed for this experiment, the immune system sees it as a threat and develops a resistance to the NeuroGen, taking much longer for it to work." frowning, Larry replied. "True, we could still swap the pieces of your brains back into your rightful bodies but, by the time the NeuroGen heals everything..." he shook his head. "You will both suffer from severe brain damage or worse, be killed."

"Is there a way to bypass the immune system?" hoping, I asked.

"Not without taking the chance of harming the immune system, leading to worse complications." serious, Larry replied. "We will work on a way but it could take years." he sighed. "This swap, for all purposes, is permanent. This is your last chance to back out, if you so wish."

"No, we agreed to this and we finish what we start." steeling myself, I said. Cassandra nodded in agreement.

"Very well." nodding, Larry said. "Gloria and I will leave while you disrobe and change into the robes for the procedure."

With that, the two left the room without a word, closing the door behind them. Cassandra and I sighed then we both gave each other a final nod and turned, back to back to disrobe. We were twins so adjusting would not be too difficult, at least I hoped. Within minutes, we were changed and Larry returned moments later with Gloria at her side.

"Please lay down onto the operating tables so we may begin." politely, he said. "Make yourselves comfortable while Gloria administers the anesthetic."

We did as Larry instructed and made ourselves comfortable before Gloria gentle took my arm and injected me with the anesthetic then did the same to Cassandra. It must have been very strong stuff as I felt myself going numb before the world around me vanished and I fell into darkness...
1131.title: The swap

11311.content:
I woke up slowly, in stages. First, I was aware a low sound... 'beep... beep... beep...' I did not know what it was but it seemed close. Next, I was aware of a smell, the odor of a sterilizing chemicals; a smell one would expect to detect from a hospital room. Then I felt something touching my chest. It was round, metallic, and cold. The momentary shock of a cold object touching me forced a low moan to escape my lips. The object was lifted.

"Her heart rate has returned to normal, Larry." with relief, a familiar sound said. "She's starting to come around."

"She?" confused, I thought. then I remembered. Right... the body swap experiment, I'm Cassandra now."

"Wait for her to wake up then run her through the check list, I will do the same with her brother." quivering with a certain excitement, Larry's voice replied.

The doctor's voice had some static in it, suggesting they were talking over an intercom or two way radio. Slowly, I opened my eyes and became aware of a new weight on my chest as I saw Gloria smiling at me. "Please bear with me for as moment." softly, she said. "We need to ensure nothing was left for chance." pausing, the said, "Sit up, please."

I did so and Gloria asked me to move my arms in a circle then rotate my wrists before flexing each finger and turning my head in various directions. "Good, your motor skills seem fine so far." pleased, she said. "Please try to stand, I will help you steady yourself."

I did so and Gloria ran me through another barrage of physical motions before she began to poke me with a long metal rod that looked a lot like a radio antenna. "Do you feel this?... this?... this?" poking me in several places, she asked.

"Yes, I can feel everywhere." annoyed, I said. "Please stop poking me."

Gloria gave a low yell of joy and hit an intercom button. "The first body swap on this end was a complete success!" excited, she announced. "We did it, doctor!"

"Likewise on my end, Gloria." excited, Larry replied over the speaker. "We have all just made history!"

Gloria gave another happy yell then turned to me. "I'll leave so you can get dressed." smiling she said. "We'll wait for you in the lab for a little celebration.

With that, she left the room and I turned to Cassandra's clothes, neatly folded and ready for me to wear.
11311.title: David wakes up first

113111.content:
I had no trouble getting the panties on, they were just like my own briefs, just... softer. I winced, trying not to think about it as I then picked up the bra and examined it before releasing a sigh of relief.

"I'm glad Cassandra did me the favor of wearing a sports bra today," surprised by my new voice, I said. "It should go on much like a T-shirt, I hope."

Although I struggled slightly, trying to make the bra fit comfortably, I managed to get it on straight then turned to Cassandra's sweat pants and blouse. We had both agreed to wear gender neutral clothing to the procedure to limit the discomfort until when we were in the privacy of our own homes. It was the best thing we could ever agree upon, even though Cassandra never really liked anything too girlie. Once I was fully dressed, including socks and tennis shoes, I looked at myself in the mirror and sighed. "This is what I am going to look like for the rest of my life." whispering, I said. "At least she, err, I don't have a boyfriend at this time."

Taking another look at myself in the mirror, I slowly walked out of the room to find Dr Larry Thompson and his assistant, Gloria waiting for me with Cassandra, now David, standing nervously near by. "Gloria and I would like to thank you both for making this experiment a complete success." excited, Larry said. "You two have both made medical history!"

"Although your names will be kept a close guarded secret, your stories will be on the front page of every medical journal in the world!" equally excited, Gloria said. "Body swapping is now a reality!"

With that, Larry popped open a bottle of champagne as Gloria pulled four glasses from a box on a table. "Please join us in a toast to our to our success." pouring the first glass, Larry said. "After all, your two made it possible."

"Forgive me but... are we old enough to drink that?" wincing slightly, David asked. "Also, don't you think it's too early after an operation to drink alcohol?"

Gloria's smile faltered a little. "Sorry, David." realizing the mistake, she said. "We got caught up in the excitement."

"Yes, I apologize as well." looking guilty, Larry said. "Do you mind if we toast the two of you?"

David and I turned to each other then shrugged before turning back to them. "Please do." in unison, we said.

Larry rose his glass. "To David and Cassandra Mason." smiling, he said. "The twins who swapped bodies for science."

Gloria raised her glass in turn. "Here here!" smiling, she declared.

After drinking down the glass of champagne, they hugged each other, cheering. Once they had composed themselves, Gloria led David and I back to waiting room to meet mom...
113111.title: Getting dressed

1131111.content:
Mom sat up on the couch she had taken a nap on when we entered the waiting area. She turned from me to Cassandra, with a look of worry. "Well...?" struggling for words, she asked. "How do you two feel?"

"It feels weird, being my sister." after a pause, I said. "Her hair is short but its still longer than what mine was, I can feel it brushing against the back of my neck and it smells different than what I am used to." wincing, I added, "The extra weight on my chest will take some getting used to."

"That's why we decided on gender neutral clothes to start with." nodding, David said. "I can't get over this breeze on the back of my neck and the smell of my hair is different as well." he then winced, saying, "I too have an extra weight but I really don't want to think about it right now."

"The body swap was a complete success, Mrs. Mason." smiling, Larry said. "Your mortgage will be paid in full by the end of the month with the agreed monetary reward being transferred into your family account the week after."

"Both David and Cassandra are perfectly healthy." assuring mom, Gloria said. "Being twins, with similar interests and friends, they will have an easier transition and be able to return to a normal life much faster than other pairs might."

"Am I free to take them home?" hopeful, mom asked.

"They are free to return home." nodding, Larry said. "Just return here in a week so we can confirm that everything is working properly." seeing mom's worry increasing, he quickly said, "Just to be on the safe side."

Mom nodded, releasing a breath then turned to David and I. "Let's go home."

The ride home was not as quiet as the ride to the procedure with David and I quietly going over our daily routines to prepare ourselves for the transition. Again, it only made sense. In what seemed like no time at all, we arrived home where we were approached by the rest of our family. Dad seemed worried while Amelia seemed bemused and Melody seemed confused. "Dey change?" trying to understand what she was told earlier, she asked. "Dey wook da same."

I giggled at that then paused, wondering if that reaction came from the body or if I actually did it on my own. Sensing my thoughts, as David had chuckled, he said, "We'll deal with it one step at a time."
1131111.title: Returning home

11311111.content:
David's POV

"Is that really you inside there, Cassandra?" touching David's shoulder, dad asked.

"Yeah, it's me, daddy." wincing, Cassandra replied. "I was always considered to be 'one of the guys'." he chuckled slightly. "I'll admit, I never expected to be that way literally."

Dad chuckled himself then sighed. "I would not have thought any different of you, had you decided to back out." serious, he said. "Please forgive me when I don't treat you as my 'little girl' anymore."

"That would be a bit awkward, if you did." blushing, Cassandra said.

"How are you holding up, David?" gently lifting Cassandra's chin to see her, mom asked. "Are you feeling okay?"

"I feel fine, considering." shrugging, I replied. "As you can guess, being a girl is going to take some getting used to." wincing, I added, "I'll accept any help I can get."

Mom smiled. "There is much to learn, Cassandra, err, David and I will help you all we can." gently, she said. "I expect you and your father to help David all you can in return."

"Of course." nodding, I replied. "We've already gone over each others daily routines."

"Talking about them and actually doing them are two different things, young lady." patiently, mom said. "There is an art to a woman cleaning and preparing herself for the day."

"Your mother is right, young man." eying Cassandra, dad said. "There is a certain ritual to men getting ready in the morning as well."

Cassandra and I turned to each other, uncertain. Although we had told each other we had to bathe each day, we did not go into any fine details.

Cassandra's POV

"Oh my..." remembering something, I thought. I didn't wear a pad before the switch, I was so nervous. I gulped slightly, which mom noticed. "My, err, her time of the month is due any day now."

"Is something wrong... David?" still not used to the switch, mom asked.

"Um... 'Aunt Flow' is due for a visit soon." wincing, I said. "We had not discussed that part of womanhood yet."

"Aunt Flow?" confused, David asked. "Who is she?"

"Were you wearing a pad before the switch?" turning to me, mom asked.

I shook my head and mom took David by the arm. "Come with me to the bathroom, dear." firmly but kindly, she said. "We'll need to cover the basics of a woman's menstrual cycle."

David's eyes went wide as she understood. "Oh, man..."

"Welcome to womanhood, David." giggling, mom said. "It's not as bad as you might think."

After mom had vanished upstairs with David, dad turned to me. "You will soon be on the receiving end of those mood swings you used to have during your time of the month." seriously, he said. "Try to be patient with her."

"I'll try, daddy." chuckling slightly, I said. "I feel I must point out, though, that men have mood swings too."

"That we do." nodding, dad said. "Its going to be a new and, I'm sure, sometimes frightening transition for you both."

We both paused, hearing David's high pitched scream coming from the upstairs bathroom.
11311111.title: Talking with the family

choices: our new neighbors, the Harris family.
113111111.content:
"Don't feel embarrassed, we are both girls here." closing the bathroom door, mom said. "I need you to pull down your sweatpants and panties so I can show you how to use a pad."

I sighed, knowing that this was a part of a girl's life, and casually pulled down the sweatpants. Only, as I moved to pull down the panties, I spotted a red stain and quickly pulled them down to find that I was bleeding from my nether regions! Although I knew what was happening, my first reaction was to scream.

"Calm down, Cassandra." gently, mom said. "Its perfectly natural for a girl your age." she urged me out of my clothes then helped me into the shower. "Get cleaned up and I'll show you how to use a pad."

I took a few breaths to calm myself then screamed again as mom peeked inside, holding two bottles in her hand. "Mom! What!?!" screaming, I asked. "Get out!"

"You need to learn the fine art of cleaning yourself as a woman, Cassandra." firmly but kindly, mom said. "I grant you, this is an awkward time but its better to get it done and over with quickly."

Mom then went on to explain the body wash and shampoo before going on about not missing a single square inch of my body as a girl's skin is more sensitive. "Take care cleaning your nether regions while on your period." warning me, mom said. "It will be more sensitive at this time."

With that, she left me to take my quick shower. I was annoyed that she peeked in while I was naked in the shower but her advice and instructions proved useful as I discovered Cassandras' body, now mine, was very sensitive indeed. It was a small wonder why she used such delicate soaps and shampoos. "Why did Cassandra, or rather, I have to have my time of the month just after the body swap!?" annoyed, I asked.

"A girl can't control when it comes each month, dear." simply, mom replied from the other side of the curtain. "Its when it doesn't come you have to really worry."

"Mom, I just became a girl today!" blushing brightly, I protested. "Dating boys is the last thing on my mind!"

"I'm just stating the facts, Cassandra." patiently, mom said. "A girl has a lot more to worry about when it comes to sex than boys as they take the risk of getting pregnant..."

I sighed, stepping out of the shower as mom continued to deliver me 'The Talk' from a girl's perspective. "You are new to the feminine world, Cassandra." with a worried look, mom said. "I just don't want to see you get taken advantage of."

"Why are you calling me Cassandra all of a sudden?" curious, I asked. "Also, did you get me any clean clothes to put on before I go back down stairs?"

"That is who you are now... Cassandra." gently, mom said. "Its for the best if we call you both by your new names and move on; it will be easier for all of us." then a knock came to the door and mom peered out. "Thank you Amelia." she said. "These will do."

"You asked Amelia to get me clean clothes!?" startled, I asked. "Mom, you know how she is..."

"Calm down, her selections were not all that bad." smiling, mom said. "Besides, I ordered her to get them from your dresser, Cassandra."

I moaned, expecting a tight pair of pink panties, a mini skirt, and a tank top but sighed in relief when I found a pair of regular panties and bra with a pair of blue jeans, white socks and a yellow blouse. Mom giggled, seeing my reaction. "Amelia will undoubtedly annoy you later but, for now, let's get you dressed."

Minutes later, mom and I returned to the living room where Cassandra winced, seeing my annoyed look and mouthed, 'sorry' before jumping at the sound of someone ringing the doorbell.

"I'm not expecting anyone." curious, dad said, walking to the door.

He opened the front door to reveal...
113111111.title: Introduction to womanhood

1131111111.content:
David's POV

As mom answered the door, I heard a snicker and turned to find Amelia with a bemused look on her face. "I heard you are having your first period... Cassandra." stressing my new name, she said. "On your first day as a girl, no less." she shook her head. "Well, deal with it. You'll be getting them every month for a long time to come."

"It comes with the territory, I can handle it." trying to be patient, I said. "It could have easily been you switching bodies with me, remember that."

Ms Harris ushered her kids and I into the house where Mark led me to his room. "It's not much to look at, I fear." wincing, he said. "At least its clean."

I rolled my eyes at that and entered a small but tidy bedroom with a small bed under a window against the far wall, a walk in closet on the left with a door to a washroom next to it, and a dresser and entertainment system to the right. "Well, you were right, its not much to look at." closing the door, I said. "Maybe we can..."

My voice froze in my throat as I saw the wall on either side of the door. It was covered with framed band posters, each with a first single CD! They were all current bands, each the most popular on the radio charts and CD sales! Among them were epic photographic shots of the bands on stage! I found myself fighting the urge to scream. "Who would have guessed this guy had such an awesome collection?"

"I love photography and music." standing behind me, Mark said. "Because of my small size, I can get the best shots of the bands performing without being noticed by the crowds. The bands love the pictures I take, one group asked me to go on tour with them." he then sighed. "Only I don't get a lot of credit for the photos; just these posters, a few extra shots, and pay for my time."

"Hobnobbing with the hottest bands, getting free stuff!, asked to go on tour!?" my hart racing, I thought. "This kid was the coolest boy in school and no one had a clue! The lost opportunities... I feel sick!"

"Um... Amelia?" nervous, Mark asked. "You wanted to see my closet?"

I sighed, forcing myself to pull my eyes away from Mark's collection. The very thought of what I could have had, getting to know the 'shy midget', made me want to cry. Then, a thought came to me and I asked, "Mark do you still take pictures of the bands?"

"Of course." honestly, Mark replied. "I'll be taking pictures of City Boys on stage next week."

Again, I fought the urge to scream. City Boys was the hottest group to hit the stage and their concert had been sold out for weeks. "If I can get in, I'll be the envy of all my friends!" a dreamy smile forming.

"Amelia, my closet?" becoming worried, Mark asked.

"Yes, right!" quickly, I said. "Your closet." I gave a nervous giggle. "Sorry, I'm just taking everything in so I can form a strategy for you, okay?"

"Okay..." taking a step back, Mark said. "Well, here it is."

Mark opened the closet and I saw....
113111111111121.title: Shyness hides the coolness

1131111111111211.content:
Amelia's POV.

I sighed, seeing shirts from the nineteen eighties. None of them were colorful or, in any way, stylish. "Doesn't your family buy you any stylish clothing?" concerned, I asked. "I mean there's no color. I'm surprised your dad hasn't said anything about this."

Mark began to sob. I turned to him, worried. I did not want his sister to barge in and pound me for stating my opinion. "Hey, we'll work on it, okay?" wincing, I said. "I promised to help and here I am."

"Dad's dead, I work to help pay the bills." crying, Mark said. "Its part of my job to be 'invisible'. The crowds don't pay any attention to a tiny boy in drab clothing..." he sighed. "I guess I should be used to it by now."

"What happened to your dad?" curious, I asked.

"He- He was an oil rig firefighter, he died on the job; an explosion." crying more, Mark replied. "Mom works but we can't afford everything on just one job, I don't think anyone can, this is all I got."

"What about the money you made from taking pictures of the bands on stage?" pointing to his collection, I asked. "You have the right to some decent clothing, not... this."

"Mom offered to get me better clothing but food and a roof over our heads is more important."

"He must think he's now the man of the house and has to provide for the family before himself. guessing, I thought. "Still, if all he needs is a new wardrobe..." I turned to Mark and said, "Even the man of the house needs to spoil himself a little. Do you have any money to work with?"

Mark looked at me, uncertain, then replied...
1131111111111211.title: Drab, boring clothing

11311111111112111.content:
Amelia's POV

Mark looked at me, uncertain, then replied, "I have some money saved up but I need it for college."

"First impressions are the most important, Mark." patiently, I pointed out. "Sure, you may need to be 'invisible' in a crowd while on the job but why curse yourself with that in public?"

"I- I don't know." looking away, Mark replied. "Ever since dad died..."

"Your dad would want you to be happy." quickly, I countered. "I'm sure your mom and sister want you to be happy too; splurge a little."

Mark fell silent, his eyes uncertain. "He's going to be a tough nut to crack." wincing, I thought. I looked at Mark's collection then a thought occurred to me. "Mark, does anyone else know about your job with the bands?"

Mark shook his head. "You are the first, outside of my family to know about this." frowning, he replied. "I want people to like me for who I am not what I can give them."

That hit a nerve as I was thinking about using him to get into a concert. "Sarah would pound me for sure if I 'use and lose' her brother." frowning back, I thought. "My family would not be too pleased either.

After a moment of thought, I muttered, "You stay 'invisible' because you're afraid someone would try to take advantage of you but, in doing so, you aren't happy."

Mark began to sob again, giving me my answer. "You can stand out without anyone knowing of your job, Mark." touching his shoulder, I said. "Remember the band, KISS? They wore makeup masks so no one would recognize them when out in public."

"I know that." slightly annoyed, Mark replied. "What does that have to do with me?"

"You are wearing the same clothes for work and school." pointing at his closet, I stated. "Sooner or later, someone is going to figure it out. What will you do then?"

Mark paused, I could tell I had gotten through to him. "May- Maybe I could use a few new outfits." softly, he admitted.

I smiled. "I'll talk to your mom and sister." leading Mark to the door, I said. "We can all go to the mall together."

"You- You want to be seen with someone like me?" surprised, Mark asked.

"It will be worth it to get into that concert next week." smiling, I thought. "I just have to be careful how I ask him for those tickets." then I replied, "You listen to too many rumors; I'm not the evil school bitch some people play me out to be. On a whole, I'm a saint."

Mark folded his arms, unimpressed. "Tell me another one." sarcastically, he said.

"Okay, maybe not a saint." rolling my eyes, I said. "Still, I'm not a demon either."

Mark chuckled.
11311111111112111.title: I have some saved up.

113111111111121111.content:
David's POV

After Amelia had left with the Harris family, Cassandra and I began to talk about our clothing styles and decided that we were both passed due for a few new outfits. With the mortgage soon to be paid in full and fifty thousand dollars already in the family account, dad agreed to a small shopping spree with a celebration to follow after Amelia returns from helping Mark, whatever help she may offer.

"Somehow I doubt you will be looking at the skirts and dresses." smiling, Cassandra said as we entered the mall.

"No, that part of Cassandra will stay the same." shaking my head, I replied. "On the same token, I'd like to find my own style so I feel like myself and can eventually say, with honesty, 'I am Cassandra'."

"Well said." smiling, mom remarked. "You two are adjusting better than we had originally hoped."

"There will be challenges, of course." driving, dad said. "You may not realize it but the two of you are treated a little differently by your friends."

"Because of out genders?" curious, I asked.

"Its more complicated than that." chuckling, dad replied. "You will see for yourselves when you meet up with them later."

I shrugged, not really knowing how our friends ever treated Cassandra and I differently but I decided to let it go for now and walked over to the ladies department. With mom helping me, I began to look for some jeans that had a hint of embroidery on them. It was not because I wanted to attract attention to myself, far from it; I just did not like my clothes to be plain and ordinary. It had to have something that made it slightly unique from the norm. Nothing dramatic, like Amelia might wear, but just enough to call it my style.

"What about this pair, Cassandra?" holding up a pair of jeans, mom asked.

I looked at the jeans; they had a fire design, made of glass beads, sewn onto the lower pant legs. "Too flashy." shaking my head, I said. "I'm looking for something more subtle."

Returning to my search, I found a pair I was looking for. It had a line of glass beads following the stitch line of the front pockets and another following the hem line of the pant legs. "This will do." smiling, I said.

"Trying to come out of your tomboy phase, Cassandra?" giggling, a voice asked.

Startled, I turned and found myself facing...
113111111111121111.title: At the mall

1131111111111211111.content:
David's POV

I spun around, startled, to find our friend, Stephen Anderson, eying me with a curious look on his face. He looked at the jeans I was holding then turned to me. "This is not like you, picking out jeans that have a bit of flash to them." a puzzled look forming, he stated. "I can see David picking out something like this from the men's department but not you."

"Well..." My mind was racing; I was not sure if this was the proper time or place to tell Stephen what had happened to Cassandra and I and why. Forcing a smile, I replied, "I just thought it was time for something new."

I turned to Cassandra fro help but quickly found that he was having troubles of her own as she had bumped into our other friend, Laura Clarke, who was questioning him about 'his' clothing choices. I then turned to mom who merely shrugged, I was on my own. "Well, at least you're sticking with jeans." smiling, Stephen said. "I'd be worried if you suddenly switched to skirts, or worse, dresses."

Deciding to joke with Stephen I gave him a mock annoyed look and asked, "What's wrong with skirts and dresses?"

"No-Nothing." surprised by my reaction, Stephen replied. "Its just that you never wore them before."

"Relax, Stephen." smiling, I said. "I'm only joking." then I turned serious. "I'm just trying some new looks to see if they suit me, that's all."

"Well, I'm no expert in ladies fashions." chuckling a little, Stephen said. "Still, I think those jeans would look real good on you, why not try them on?"

Cassandra's POV

I entered the men's department and looked at the various shirts. There was a fine collection of solid colored Ts but I knew that David enjoyed to wear the custom Ts as his own subtle way to stand out. I pulled out one shirt that had the face of Eisenstein and read the phrase under it, 'Hip to be squared'. "How corny." chuckling, I whispered.

"It's so you." laughing, a voice stated.

I turned around, startled, to find our friend, Laura Clarke, looking at me with a bemused look on her face. She looked at the shirt I was holding then turned back to me. "I know you like to wear things that have a unique touch to them but I never knew you to wear anything that would bring you any real attention." curious, she said. "This is not like you."

"I'm... just tweaking my look, that's all." thinking fast, I replied. "Just because I look at a shirt doesn't mean I'm going to buy it or even try it on."

"You usually avoid this section as if it were the plague." her bemused smile returning, Laura pointed out. "Yeah, you wear Ts that have Japanese symbols or subtle designs but nothing like this." she paused. "I guess you are searching out for a new style."

"Well, yeah." giving Laura a nervous smile. "Cassandra and I are both here, doing that."

"Really?" her smile brightening, Laura asked. "Maybe we can help." she then sighed. "I'd just wish she'd try on a skirt or dress, let the princess out every now and then."

"I doubt you'll talk Cassandra into trying on any skirts or dresses." serious, I said.

"Easy, David." giggling, Laura said. "You know I'd never pressure any of you into anything. Still, I think she would find a trip to the salon very relaxing."

"I wouldn't know." honestly, I said. then I thought, "I guess dad was right, Stephen and Laura do treat us a little differently; she never mentioned going to the salon to be before."

I turned to find David talking to Stephen then turned back to Laura to find her smiling. "I know that look, Laura." feeling nervous, I said. "What are you thinking?"

Laura's smile broadened. "A fashion parade." gently taking my hand, she replied.

Before I could protest, Laura pulled me out of the men's department and led me to the ladies department across the aisle, where Stephen and Brian were talking. "Hey, Cassandra." announcing herself, she said. "David told me that you and he are looking to tweak your look."

"Something like that." with a nervous smile, David replied.

"Let us help you." still smiling, Laura said. "We'll make it a fashion parade, it'll be fun."

"I like that idea." smiling, Stephen said. He then turned to David and I. "What do you guys think?"

David and I exchanged a startled look then turned to mom and dad to find them down the aisle, talking to Amelia and the Harris family, we were on our own...

What am I to do?
1131111111111211111.title: Enter our friends

11311111111112111111.content:
David's POV

"Um... no offense, Laura but I'd like to find my own style." trying not to sound annoyed, I replied. "I know you'd like to see the 'lady' in me come out but I'm just as much a woman in jeans as I am in skirts."

Though Laura and Stephen did not see, Cassandra gave a discrete nod and smile as if telling me she could not have said it better herself in her old body. Laura gave me a slight pout then smiled. I could tell she was a little disappointed but this was not something I was ready for and I doubted Cassandra was ready either.

"I understand." sighing, Laura said. she smiled. "Maybe you'll show us your new wardrobe picks later?"

I smiled, glad that Laura was not taking my declining her help too badly. "Sure, we can meet at the food court for lunch."

"Sound good." smiling, Laura said.

Cassandra's POV

"I hate to burst your bubble, Stephen." wincing, I said. "You know I always liked to find my own style in everything, my bro, err, sister is the same way." I sighed. "Careful, girl!"

"No sweat." smiling, Stephen said. "I just thought I'd throw the offer in, you know, in case you needed my 'expert' fashion advice."

"Whatever." giggling. "David chimed in. "Expert in computers I'll give you but fashion...?"

I chuckled, knowing that David had reacting just as I would have in that situation. Stephen chuckled back, smiling more. "Okay, okay." he said. "We'll see you guys at the food court in a few hours."

"Thanks, Stephen." patting him on the back, I said. "We'll see you two later."

With that, our friends walked away in good spirits while David and I shared a sigh. "We're going to have to tell them eventually before they figure it out for themselves." quietly, I said.

"Yeah, they're both very intelligent and insightful." watching our friends leave, David said. "We won't be able to keep this secret from them forever." he sighed then pointed to the men's department across the aisle. "Why don't I help you find something more your style then you can do the same for me to save time."

I nodded. "Agreed."

David's POV

For the next hour, I worked with Cassandra as we sifted through the rack and shelves of men's clothing and eventually found a few outfits that she liked on her new body. It was much like her own style but in the male equivalent, which was what we had planned from the start.

"Well, now that you have your new look, you can tweak my, err, your wardrobe more to your liking."

"Yeah, I like these outfits." nodding, Cassandra replied. "Now I have a better idea on where to start at home." she smiled. "Thanks... sis."

I smiled back. "You're welcome... bro."

Cassandra's POV

After David helped me piece together a few great outfits I could easily live with, it was my turn to help him find some girl's outfits he could live with in my body. We spent the next hour and a half, going through the racks and shelves of clothes but it was not a simple matter of shirts, pants and drawers. I had to explain to David how to find his cup size when picking out new bras and why tight jeans were not a good idea for either gender. All in all, David did well and we headed towards the food court with mom and dad following.

"Well, now you can tweak your new wardrobe." smiling, I said to David.

David smiled. "This was almost fun." smiling back, David replied. he then moaned slightly. "Blasted cramps."

"They will subside." touching David's shoulder, I said. "Did you bring sanitary pads with you?"

David nodded, motioning to a purse he was carrying over his shoulder. "I don't feel any... leaks, yet." wincing, he whispered. "Remind me, how long do these last?"

"A few days to a week." sighing, I replied. "This is only the first day, hang in there."

The two of us fell silent as we reached the food court...
11311111111112111111.title: Private Fashion Parade

113111111111121111112.content:
David's POV

At the food court, we showed Laura and Stephen our purchases. We then told them we were tweaking our look to get Amelia off our backs for a while. It was certainly a plausible explanation as they knew well how much of a pain our sister could be. Upon reaching the family car, we saw Amelia waiting for us. She had a sour pout on her face and the remnants of tears in her eyes. Wondering what had happened, I turned to see the Harris family walking towards their own car; Mark was crying and Sarah had a look that could kill on her face while their mother did her best to hold her back.

"I had a feeling this would happen." shaking my head, I whispered. "Amelia blew it."

"What happened, Amelia?" firmly, mom asked. "I thought you were going to help Mark. Why are you not with him and why is he in tears?"

"It's so completely unfair!" wailing, Amelia said. "I discovered that Mark hobnobs with the hottest bands, getting free stuff and even asked to go on tour with them!"

"What does that have to do with helping Mark gain confidence and self esteem?" unimpressed, dad asked. "You said you could help him, what went wrong?"

Amelia sobbed a little. "He had tickets to the sold out City Boys concert!" distraught, she replied. "Only he gave them to his family; they could have, should have been mine!" pouting, she added, "I was so mad! I wanted to tell him that he'll always be a loser but instead, I just left him!"

"You what!?" stunned, Cassie asked. "You only offered to help Mark to get concert tickets!?!" turning red, she added, "Then, when you didn't get what you wanted, you left him on his own!?!"

"That's a new low!" furious, I hissed. "Even for you, Amelia!"

"We'll talk about this at home." angrily, dad said. "Everyone get in."

Cassandra's POV

The drive home was quiet and uncomfortable. I could feel the heat of mom and dad's anger and was relieved that it was not towards David or I. "I'd hate to be in her shoes right now." wincing, I thought. "This is the worst thing she has done yet."

"I didn't insult him or anything." defending himself, Amelia said.

"We'll talk at home, young lady." with a strained voice, mom replied. "When we can discuss this in private."

I winced, hearing that and wondered what they would do to her. More than that, I wondered how Mark was holding up after what Amelia did to him. "Poor guy." looking out the window, I thought. "Maybe I should give him a call later."
113111111111121111112.title: Returning home.

choices: A private talk with Mark and Sarah.
1131111111111211111122.content:
David's POV.

Two weeks had passed with no contact with the Harris family. Cassandra and I had tried to call Mark or Sarah a number of times but no one answered the telephone. Amelia was grounded with 'house arrest' for the two weeks, she was not allowed to venture anywhere outside of the house for any reason except for cases of emergency. Cassandra and I had spent the time wisely, getting used to being a member of the opposite sex, having each other as a 'coach'. There were still many things I had to get used to. I never knew just how many boys actually tried to convince her to date them. Cassandra giggled at me as I read over the latest small stack of love letters.

"Welcome to my, well, your world." smiling, Cassandra said. "I usually hide them and later send them through the shredder."

"You didn't even read them?" surprised, I asked.

"Oh, I read them." nodding, Cassandra replied. "Right up until I realized that they were love letters." she smiled. "When I, or rather, you are ready to date, you will find someone."

I smiled back but my response was cut short by Amelia running passed the door, yelling, "I'm free!"

"Her house arrest must have finally expired." softly, Cassandra said. "It will be good to have her out of our hair for a while."

I nodded in agreement but paused as the telephone rang.

Cassandra's POV.

"Who could that be?" curious, I wondered aloud.

Moments later, mom called from downstairs. "Cassandra, you have a phone call." worry in her voice, she said. "It's Sarah, she seems very upset."

I exchanged a startled look with David then ran down the stairs with her following. Mom pointed to the telephone in the living room and I picked it up. "Hello?"

"David, we're in real trouble!" sobbing and distraught, Sarah's voice said. "It's me, Mark!"

"Mark!?" stunned, I asked. "What!? No! You didn't!"

"We did..." choking down a sob, Mark replied. "We swapped bodies."

"I'm sure Dr. Larry Thomas informed you that there is no way to switch back, once it's done." to David's shock I said. "You will just have to get used to being each other."

"We tried!" crying harder, Mark wailed. "We tried and made a mess of things!"

"What do you mean you made a mess of things?" worried, I asked. "What happened!?"

I turned to see David looking at me, worried. We were both glad that Amelia was not here to listen to this as she would make things worse. David mouthed, "What happened?"

Placing my hand onto the receiver, I whispered, "Sarah and Mark swapped bodies but Mark said they made a mess of things."

David winced as I then turned back to the phone to hear Mark, now Sarah, was still crying. "Mark, get a hold of yourself!" firmly, I said. "You are supposed to be a tomboy."

"I know that." sniffling, Mark said. "I tried to be one but I just couldn't, no matter how hard I tried."

"How long ago did you swap bodies?" curious, I asked.

There was a pause, as Mark sobbed. "Two weeks ago." finally, he, or rather, she said.

I sighed. "They both jumped right into it without any preparation or planning." frustrated, I thought. "I can just imagine the mess they are in right now, unable to act like each other."

"David, please!" sobbing, Mark pleaded. "Help us!"

"Okay, Okay." quickly, I said. "Can you come up to the house in an hour? We'll try to help you straighten all of this out."

"Your house?" calming down a little, Mark asked. "One hour?"

"Can you get here?" patiently, I pressed.

"We'll come." taking over the phone, Mark's voice said. "See you in an hour."

When the call ended, I sighed, placing the receiver down. "What a mess..." muttering, I said.

"Let me guess, they were not properly prepared when they swapped bodies." serious, David said.

"They were not prepared at all." annoyed, I replied. "I'll grant you that no one can really prepare for something like this but we are so much alike..."

"And they are practically polar opposites." sighing, David said. "I wonder how much trouble they made for themselves in trying to be each other."

I shrugged. "We'll find out in an hour."
1131111111111211111122.title: A desperate call for help.

choices: As me again in a few hours.
113111111111121112.content:
David's POV

I shook my head, watching Amelia leave with the Harris family. "I don't know who to feel more sorry for; Mark for placing his trust in Amelia or Amelia for risking a pounding from Mark's sister, Sarah." bemused, I muttered.

"It should be interesting to hear what happens over there." hiding a smile, Cassandra whispered. she then turned serious. "We have our own issues to deal with."

"Tell me about it." wincing, I said. "These cramps are killing me."

"They will pass." giggling slightly, Cassandra replied. "Did mom give you The Talk?"

"Oh, yes." rolling my eyes, I said. "Better now than later, I guess."

"Another thing, you need to avid slouching when you sit or stand." taking hold of my shoulders, Cassandra said. "If you do that too long, you will have a stiff back later. Trust me, I know; that body used to be mine."

"I thought certain learned habits and skills stayed with the body." surprised, I said. "How is this different?"

"I didn't do this of habit, I had to constantly remind myself not to slouch." simply, Cassandra replied. "Keeping a 'proper' posture is a pain but its worth it to avoid muscle stiffness later."

"Wow, I didn't know that about you." concerned, I said. "Did you tell mom and dad?"

"Of course I did." serious, Cassandra said. "Nothing serious was found so.." he paused. "I only told you because we both have a habit of slouching but I pay for it later."

"I'll try to remember that." wincing, I said. "Is there any way to ease the cramping?"

"Everything okay?" walking up to us, mom asked.

Cassandra sighed. "David, I mean, Cassandra is having trouble with her first period." he said.

"Well, I have some Mydol upstairs in my bedroom." taking my hand, mom said. "While we are there, we can discuss something I was hoping to ask Cassandra before we were offered... this."

Knowing 'this' meant the body swap experiment, I nodded. "What did you want to discuss, mom?" curious, I asked.

"In private." quickly, mom replied. "You will understand in a minute."

I followed mom into her bedroom where she closed the door behind us. I did not notice that she had locked it behind her. She then walked to her nightstand to retrieve a bottle of Mydol from the drawer. "Take one of these every six hours, as needed." handing me the bottle, she instructed. "Don't take more than four per day or you'll risk making things worse."

I opened the bottle and took down one of the pills. "You said you wanted to discuss something with me."

Mom sighed. "Please look at this through a young woman's eyes, as that is who you now are." turning to me, she said. "Gloria Adams, Dr Thompson's assistant, is getting married next month. We had been helping her and her fiance, Kyle Rogers as best we could."

"I remember; dad was asked to be the best man." politely, I said. "What does this have to do with me?"

"Well..." blushing slightly, mom replied. "We're short one bridesmaid."

My jaw dropped as I realized mom wanted me to fill that position. "Are you serious?" blushing, I asked.

Mom winced before nodding. "We are in a bit of a bind here, Cassandra." pleading, mom said. "I know this is a lot to ask of you the first day, being a girl but I would really appreciate it if you agree to do this."

"I guess this was why you didn't want 'David' to hear this." sitting down, I said.

"Will you do this for me?" sitting next to me, mom asked. "I promise I will help you."

"I don't know mom." sighing, I replied. "Can I think about this?"

"Sorry, but there is little time left." gently, mom said. "I need an answer tonight."

I wanted to cry but I held back the tears and replied....
113111111111121112.title: At the Mason residence...

1131111111111211121.content:
David's POV

"Well, Gloria and Dr. Thomas did get us out of a tight fix." wincing, I said. "I guess the least I could do is wear a dress for a few hours to help her out."

Mom pulled me into a warm hug. "Thank you, Cassie." stoking my hair, she said. "I would not have asked this of you if there was someone else to ask." she sighed. "I will take you and Amelia to be measured and fitted tomorrow morning before going through a hair and makeup rehearsal so try to get plenty of sleep tonight."

"Wait, Amelia is going to be a bridesmaid as well!?" shocked, I asked. I moaned. "Just great."

"Don't worry, I'll make sure she doesn't tease you too much." gently, mom said. "I know you have never worn heels but it was agreed that they will be worn by the bridesmaids so I suggest you get a pair so to get used to walking in them." I moaned at that, to which mom quickly added, "It's just for one day, I promise."

I sighed, liking this arrangement less and less. "Just keep Amelia off my case until its over." frowning, I said. "This is going to be hard enough without having to hear her going on and on about be going girly."

mom nodded. "I understand." softly, she said. "I really appreciate you agreeing to do this."

"Its fine." sighing, I said. "Wearing a dress for a little while is not going to kill me." I frowned. "I just hope David will understand and not want strangle me."

Later on, I pulled David aside and told him about the talk I had with mom.
1131111111111211121.title: I'll do it.

1131111112.content:
David's (now Cassandra) POV

My dad opened the door to reveal Stephen and Laura. "Hi Mr. Mason" Laura said. "We wanted to come and check up on David and Cassie and see how they're doing"

"Sure, come on in" dad said.

As the two of them came into the living room, Stephen said "So, how have you guys been handling all this so far?"

I looked at my former sister, now brother, and he said "Well, there's still some things I'm getting used to. Like a whole new center of gravity for starters. But it is kinda nice having some more mussel than before"

"I can agree to that, except it is kinda weird knowing I'm not quite as strong as I used to be." Standing up, I said "I'm kinda hungry, you guys want a snack or anything?"

While Stephen shook his head to suggest he wasn't hungry, Laura stood up and said "I can go for something." Laura followed me into the kitchen and took a seat at our island while I looked through the fridge for something to eat. "So, David"

"Cassandra" I said, interrupting her.

"What?"

"It was decided that we should go by our new bodies names all the time so we get used to it when we're in public" I said as I handed her one of the apples I got from the fridge.

"Oh, that makes sense. So, Cassie, I was wondering if you would be up for a trip to the mall tomorrow?"

"What for?" I asked.

"Well, with the back to school sales starting I wanted to go get some new clothes. I was just curious if you wanted to come with"

"I don't know, shopping has never been my thing"

11311111121.content:
New Cassandras POV

I woke up around 7:30 the next day. I remembered that Laura wanted to spend a lot of time at the mall today, and she was going to be over here soon so I had to start getting ready. I started by throwing on a pair of sweatpants, sports bra, and tee shirt. Then I went to the bathroom to brush my teeth, and once I got there I realized I needed to brush my hair to. After maybe ten minutes or so in the bathroom, I made my way downstairs. As I hit the last step, I heard the door open and saw Laura come in. "Hey, how's it going?" She asked.

"Pretty good, I guess. Just gotta get some breakfast" I answered.

"Great, once your done we'll head upstairs so that we can get you dressed"

"What are you talking about?" I asked. "I already got dressed"

"Oh, I'm sorry. You look like your still in your pajamas"

"What do you mean?"

"You still look like you just woke up. We'll have to work on your hair a little bit more, as well as change what your wearing"

"What's wrong with this" I asked gesturing to the clothes I had put on not to long ago.

"Nothing, if your staying in the house all day. But if your going out and about you have to at a minimum wear a pair of jeans"

"Fine" I said as I got a bowl of cereal.

I quickly scarfed it down and followed Laura upstairs to my room. Once we got there, she went straight to my new closet and grabbed a pair of jeans and handed them to me. Once I replaced the sweatpants with them Laura went to work with brushing my hair. She was easily working on it for at least a solid 10 minutes before she decided we were ready to go. I put on a pair of socks and tennis shoes and followed her out to our garage. My mom told us on the way out that she had transferred a couple hundred dollars of the $50,000 we were given into the checking accounts of David and myself, and that Laura and myself could take her car to the mall.

Once we got there and found a good parking spot Laura and I headed inside. It seemed like she had a very specific store in mind because she seemed like she was on a mission. Once we got there she seemed like a kid in a candy store as she took a look at every rack of clothes, pulling nearly every other thing off to get a better look. Occasionally she'd ask me how I liked this or that, and I could tell I was frustrating her because there wasn't anything I was even giving the time of day.

"You can't keep doing this you know" Laura said.

"What do you mean" I asked.

"You can't keep ignoring that these are the kinda clothes you gotta wear"

"It's just, I'm not sure I'm ready. And since Cassie was never an overly feminine person I figured I'd just be that way to and keep up appearances"

"Listen, Cassie is David now. I don't think he'll mind if you change what he used to wear a little"

"I guess your right. So, what did you have in mind?"

"I was thinking of a little bet. I'll put together an outfit and if you like it, even just a tiny bit, you take this shopping trip more seriously"

"And if I don't like it"

"I stop bugging you about this"

"Deal" I said.

"Great. Head on over to the changing rooms and I'll be over there in about 15 minutes or so with something for you to try on"

I did as I was told and headed over to the dressing rooms and waited for Laura. I pulled out my phone and played some solitaire while I wanted. It felt like it had been the longest 15 minutes of my life, but eventually Laura came back with a pile of clothes in her arms. "Here you go" she said. "You think you're gonna be alright in there"

"I'll call out for you if I need help" I said with a smile on my face as I took the clothes from her. Once I entered the changing room and locked the door, I set the clothes on the bench and quickly got undressed down to my sports bra, panties, and socks. The first thing I did was put on a pair of grey skinny jeans, followed by a plain white tee shirt. Then I slid on a pair of black boots that came up a few inches past my ankles. And lastly, a black jacket and grey scarf ( https://secure.polyvoreimg.com/cgi/img-s... ). I looked in the mirror for a solid minute, before taking the jacket off and looked in the mirror again. The more I looked at this new reflection of mine, the more I realized that wearing clothes like this made Cassie's body look a lot more attractive. I'm not sure if it was that I was looking at it as my body now and not that of my sisters, but there was just something different about how Cassie looked now. And I kinda liked it.

"What's taking so long" Laura said. "I wanna see"

Slowly, I unlocked the door, opened it and stepped outside. "What do you think?" I asked, a little nervous.

"You, you look amazing. I mean, you have no idea how long I've been trying to get Cassie to wear anything feminine. And finally seeing it, it's almost like I imagined"

"Thanks" I replied. "You know, I can't believe that I'm actually going to say this, but I kinda like this"

"Really, so you'll actually try to find some stuff you like?"

"Yes, I'll actually try to find some clothes here I like" I said, before pausing for a second. "I think I'll start by getting this"

The two of us had to have spent another 3 hours or so in the store looking at clothes. Laura occasionally pulled something off the rack, suggesting that it would look really good on my or it would go good with something already in my new closet. I agreed with her most of the time, except when she'd talk about something back home. I really didn't know much about what I had back home because I hadn't looked through my clothing options back home. Eventually we headed up to the register to pay for the pile of clothes we were carrying. Just before we got there I spotted a pretty cool sweatshirt, and decided to add it to the pile.

As the cashier scanned everything, I stood there in a bit of disbelief. Just a few days ago I was a guy who wouldn't have been caught dead looking at any of these clothes. And now, Laura had managed to talk me into buying several different shirts, pants and shorts, and even a few skirts.

Once everything was paid for, Laura and I began wondering into and out of various stores inside the mall. Eventually we wondered into a show store, and spent a good while in there. I ended up purchasing a couple pairs of sandals and flats, and even a pair of ankle boots with a medium sized heel to them (Laura was really persuasive).

11313.content:
Elizabeth's POV

I was sitting in the waiting area all by myself. There was nobody around and there were only a few old magazines lying on the table that I already read before. Nevertheless seeing as there was nothing else for me to do, I decided to read them again. It did not however made me stop me thinking about my children. My children who were willing to swap their bodies to help their parents with their own problems. A mortgage which shouldn't even be known to them. I felt terrible about it, the only thought keeping me up was the fact that David and Cassandra were twins which made the swapping process easier for them and for us.

It was only then that I noticed Gloria, Dr. Thomas' assistant standing there looking at me. I immediately stood up as I thought she came to get me.

"You can sit down again Mrs. Mason Dr. Thomas is still busy. And no nothing has gone wrong." Gloria said as she sat next to me.

"Oh it was just that I thought."

"Yes I understand it. You're worried about your children." Gloria stated to which I nodded.

"I hope I get the same feelings with this one here." Gloria said pointing at her stomach.

"How far are you?" I asked interested.

"Seven months. I wished the little one would come out already, I can hardly wait for it." Gloria said excited.

"Seven months? But if I may ask why are you still at work?" I asked curious.

"Because of this major discovery we made. I was just about to go home and stay when we discovered the NeuroGen. It was too good to be true and I just couldn't stay at home and do nothing. I'm not one to sit on the fence."

I nodded to her statement. How I wished I went to college and got a job, but sadly that life wasn't meant for me. The thought still haunts me though especially on days when it's all calm and quiet. I would wish I could go out and about and have my own life earning my own money. Not that I hated that Philip was the one bringing in the money, it was just that sometimes I wished I could get something for myself. A nice dress or some high heels.

"Me and Dr. Thomas had a talk after Philip talked to your husband. We are looking for another test subject for the experiment."

"W-Why ask me? I mean aren't the kids enough?" I asked confused.

"The results we would be getting from them would be helpful indeed, however the more research data we the better results we receive. Dr. Thomas is willing to pay you another fifty thousand dollar."

Fifty thousand dollars. With that money we could do so much, it was so tempting to do it. And as an added benefit I would have a new body. But then...

"Does that mean it will not be someone from my family?" I asked her to which Gloria shook her head.

"I'm sorry, but we have someone picked out already. The question is only if you're agreeing to it." Gloria asked looking me straight into her eyes. The offer was too good to be true and besides the person who would be getting my body would get a fifty thousand dollars as well. That meant the money would come to the good of the family.

"Very well, I'll do it." I said with a shaky voice. "Do I need to go somewhere?"

"Yes just follow me please. I'll show you who you're going to swap with." Gloria said leading me to another room. There I saw....

13.content:
The body swapping procedure is possible thanks to the discovery of NeuroGen, made by Dr. Larry Thomas and his team of scientists at Ambrosia Corporation. NeuroGen is a substance capable of regenerating nerve and brain tissue, healing previously permanent injuries in a matter of hours. Applying the gel-like substance can cure paralysis, reconnect amputated limbs and much more. However, these applications were researched by other teams. Dr. Thomas and his assistant Gloria Adams were authorized to pursue another possible use of this miraculous substance: connecting a person's brain to another's body, resulting in a body swap. After a few months of research, they reached a point were human testing was considered safe. The first test subjects were two members of the Mason family.

Unfortunately, NeuroGen has a major flaw: it can only be used once on an individual. After the first use, the immune system builds up defences against NeuroGen, and a second dose would be destroyed before it could have any effect. This means the body swapping process is a one way trip. Dr. Thomas nonetheless decided that, even with this problem, body swapping was still worth pursuing, as its world-changing potential was too great to be abandonned.

The body swapping process consists of transferring a part of the brain from one body to the next. The transferred part contains personality, memories and most academical knowledge. However, abilities that are used instinctively, such as motor skills and language, stay with the body. For example, a child who swapped into an adult would acquire the ability to read or drive, but would not have access to cultural or scientific knowledge. Meanwhile, the adult in the child's body would retain all of his knowledge, but would no longer be capable of reading or driving a car.

If you are still confused about the body swapping process used in this story, please send me an email with any questions you may have. I will do my best to answer them.
